title: 5 Hacks for Closing the IT-C-Suite Divide Using Fabric, Excel, Purview & Copilot
abstract:
Enterprises still rely on 100+ complex spreadsheets for critical business processes, leaving data siloed, unmanageable, and at risk. But let’s be real- executives aren’t giving up Excel. The solution? Meet them where they work.

In this session, discover five powerful ways to bridge the IT-executive gap- empowering leaders with the tools they trust while giving IT the security, governance, and analytics they need. See how Fabric, Purview, and Copilot can eliminate silos, reduce risk, and unlock smarter decision-making - all while letting teams work seamlessly in Excel. It’s time to bring IT and the C-suite together…once and for all.

title: A Database Designer's Favorite Security and Privacy Features in SQL Server/Azure DB
abstract:
SQL Server and Azure DB include multiple features that focus on data security, privacy, and developer productivity. In this session, we will review the best features from a database designer's and developer's point of view.

- Always Encrypted
- Dynamic Data Masking
- Row Level Security
- Data Classification
- Assessments
- Defender for SQL Server
- Ledger Tables
...and more

We'll look at new and older features, why you should consider them, where they work, where they don't, who needs to be involved in using them, and what changes, if any, need to be made to applications or tools that you use with SQL Server.

You will learn:

- The pros and cons of implementing each feature
- How implementing these new features may impact existing applications
- 10 tips for enhancing SQL Server security and privacy protections

title: A Deep Dive into SQL Database in Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
The introduction of SQL database has redefined Microsoft Fabric, evolving it from a powerful analytical ecosystem into a unified data platform. By bridging transactional workloads with the expansive capabilities of data lakes and business intelligence tools, Microsoft Fabric enables organizations to address both operational and analytical needs seamlessly.

In this session, we’ll explore the potential of SQL database, which combine enterprise-scale features and capabilities of the Azure SQL Database engine with autonomous management and ease of use advantages of the Microsoft Fabric data estate.

We’ll discover core functionalities, best practices, and real-world strategies to harness these capabilities effectively. Finally, learn how to seamlessly integrate your database with other Fabric workloads, creating a tailored, high-impact data stack that empowers your solutions to thrive within the Fabric ecosystem. Don’t miss this opportunity to unlock the full potential of SQL database in Microsoft Fabric for your organization!

title: A Framework for Power BI Report UI/UX Design
abstract:
Report Designers usually are very good at spotting bad dashboards, but struggle to articulate why they are bad and better yet what we need to do to improve in them.

In my presentation, I present a step-by-step framework for designing effective Power BI reports that follow UI/UX principles

1. Developing with your End User in Mind: Understanding your Audience's Needs

2. Principles of Information Architecture: Designing clear, well structured and decluttered reports

3. Designing with Accessibility top of mind

title: A SQL Developer's Paradise: Harnessing Fabric's Innovations
abstract: Data Warehouse in Microsoft Fabric is a paradise for any skill level SQL developer. Learn how to take advantage of the newest innovations and developer experiences in Fabric. In this session, we’ll provide an overview of capabilities, share best practices, and enable you to use Fabric Warehouse to power your analytical use cases from enterprise reporting to self-service BI - and easily manage it in production - with AI infused from end-to-end.

title: AI Copilots: Accelerating Business Outcomes with Fabric
abstract: In this session, Hexaware demonstrates how Microsoft Fabric is changing the way your enterprise interacts with data using Hexaware's GenAI copilots. These AI assistants simplify data for enterprise users, including data/AI engineers, architects, data stewards, and business users. Learn how Hexaware’s GenAI copilots, Fabric readiness assessment tool, and TCO calculator accelerate data/AI pipeline creation and insights for your business. Additionally, discover real-world transformations in financial services that enable GenAI-powered insights, derive a business glossary, and create pipelines using copilots.

title: AI That Talks Like Us: Fabric Makes Chatting with Data Effortless
abstract:
In this session, internationally acclaimed speaker Chander Dhall will demonstrate how Fabric, combined with Azure OpenAI and Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL (and also MongoDB), empowers AI to sound just like a human, enabling natural, conversational interactions with your data. Imagine chatting with an AI that doesn’t just retrieve facts but speaks as if it were human, seamlessly responding in real time. Chander will showcase how these technologies work together to deliver cutting-edge conversational AI, turning complex data into accessible insights.

You’ll see live examples of AI transforming how we interact with data—using voice-based Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to enhance performance, multilingual capabilities to connect globally, and Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB to deliver real-time, scalable solutions. AI will answer in multiple languages, including Japanese, Mandarin, Hindi, French, and Arabic, demonstrating its ability to break language barriers effortlessly.

You will learn:
- How to use Fabric, Azure OpenAI, and Azure Cosmos DB, DiskANN, full text and hybrid search to create AI that sounds human.
- How to enable conversational access to your data using advanced voice RAG patterns.
- How to implement scalable, multilingual AI solutions to meet global demands.

Don’t miss this chance to explore the future of AI-powered, human-like conversations and discover practical tools to revolutionize your data interactions!

title: AI-Powered Data Engineering: Enrich and Transform Data Using Generative AI in Fabric
abstract:
In this session, we'll unlock the fundamentals of AI-powered data engineering in Fabric, covering new features that are designed to enrich and transform data using Generative AI. We'll explore the latest capabilities that streamline the crucial, time-consuming duties of data preparation, from Copilot in Fabric notebooks to AI functions for seamless text analytics.

Live demonstrations will showcase the full range of GenAI tools for data preparation in Fabric, whether you're a citizen data scientist who prefers low-code tools like Data Wrangler or an experienced data engineer looking to build pipelines at scale. You'll leave the session with the skills to uplevel your data workflows and deliver deeper insights in less time.

title: AI-Powered Development Experience with Fabric Data Factory
abstract: Explore the transformative power of Copilot for Data Factory in this engaging session focused on enhancing productivity through AI-driven capabilities. Learn how to leverage Dataflows and Data Pipelines to streamline your data integration and transformation processes.

title: AI-Powered Real-Time Intelligence: Transforming Data-Driven Decisions with Microsoft Fabric & GenAI
abstract:
In an era where timely, data-driven decisions define competitive success, Microsoft Fabric’s newest real-time intelligence capabilities are setting new standards. This presentation dives into how Fabric’s integrated AI and generative AI (GenAI) features are redefining real-time data analytics and automation. Attendees will explore Fabric’s Real-Time Hub, a streamlined platform enabling organizations to effortlessly bring together diverse data streams, and Event Streams, which seamlessly manage high-volume data capture and distribution from sources.

We’ll examine Eventhouse, Fabric’s optimized engine for high-precision, time-sensitive analytics, alongside Data Activator Integration, which automates alerts and actions triggered by AI-informed, real-time data patterns. With GenAI models embedded in these workflows, users can access predictive insights and dynamic recommendations, allowing for immediate responses to data events.

Additionally, KQL Queryset and Real-Time Dashboards will be featured, highlighting the creation of interactive visualizations, the execution of advanced queries, and the setup of live alerts—all within a single, cohesive framework. Through real-world scenarios and live demonstrations, this session showcases how the synergy of Microsoft Fabric’s AI-powered real-time intelligence and GenAI insights is empowering data teams to make fast, high-impact decisions. This talk will be valuable for data professionals and business leaders looking to leverage cutting-edge AI and real-time intelligence capabilities to drive strategic agility and precision in decision-making.

title: Accelerate Insights to Action in Power BI
abstract: Join us for an exciting session on Translytical taskflows in Fabric, a brand-new evolution in Power BI reports that enables automated action for seamless insights to actions. With Translytical taskflows, you can automate end-user actions such as updating records, adding annotations, or even creating powerful workflows that trigger actions in other systems. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn about Translytical taskflows and see tons of practical examples that elevate your reporting and streamline decision making!

title: Accelerate Transformation and Time to Business Value with Industry Solutions and Data Models
abstract: In today's fast-paced digital landscape, rapidly transforming data into actionable business value is crucial. Join us to learn how Industry Solutions and Logical Data Modeler in Microsoft Fabric will help accelerate your transformation. Industry Solutions built into Fabric provide rapid on-ramps with out-of-the-box scenarios and business value users can quickly light up – creating opportunities for both customers and partners alike. We will dive into how these can be used for efforts such as Sustainability initiatives, and industries such as Retail as one example, to quickly implement new scenarios. We will discover how industry data models harmonize and semantically enrich data, making it valuable and actionable for industry-specific challenges. We will share how you can explore and fine-tune the models according to specific needs, using these new capabilities. Finally, learn how our out-of-the-box, prebuilt AI and analytics templates accelerate AI solution delivery, empowering decision-makers across all levels—from the boardroom to the frontline. This session will provide insights and practical examples on how to leverage these tools to democratize data value and rapidly drive impactful business outcomes.

title: Accelerate Your Azure SQL Platform for Optimal Performance and Costs
abstract:
Are you struggling with database performance in the cloud? Database professionals who are new to Azure, SQL Database in Fabric, or the public cloud may face challenges understanding infrastructure differences and balancing resource costs with performance.

In this session, you will gain insights into how Azure’s infrastructure is designed to deliver database performance and how SQL Database in Fabric fits into the ecosystem. You’ll also discover the tools built into platform-as-a-service databases like Azure SQL DB and Managed Instance that can simplify your work. Plus, we’ll share real-world stories about managing these services at scale.

Whether you're navigating Azure for the first time or exploring the latest Fabric capabilities, this session will provide valuable knowledge and practical tips!

title: Accelerate Your Move to Microsoft Fabric: Key Steps, Common Pitfalls, and Best Practices
abstract: Curious about how organizations cut months off their Microsoft Fabric migration timelines? In this session, we’ll share a proven roadmap to accelerate your migration. Discover key stages of planning, execution, and optimization, along with the most common pitfalls to avoid. Walk away with a clear strategy to keep your Microsoft Fabric project on track, under budget, and primed for long-term success.

title: Accelerate the Secure Embedding of Power BI into Your Application!
abstract:
This session will cover the key concepts of how to securely embed content from Power BI workload in Microsoft Fabric with your web application.

We will discuss best practices and many resources available to developers who are just beginning or have already made progress and want to enhance their Power BI Embedded solution. In particular we will mention the Power BI Go Big program and the Embedded solution accelerators from partner program.

title: Accelerating Data Governance & AI Transformation with Microsoft Fabric, Purview, and Agentic AI
abstract:
Join us for an insightful webinar exploring how Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Purview, and Agentic AI are revolutionizing data governance, compliance, and AI-driven decision-making. Learn how enterprises can unify structured and unstructured data using Databases on Fabric, One Lake which enhance visibility with Purview’s governance capabilities, and leverage Agentic AI for autonomous decision intelligence and task execution.

Key takeaways:
✅ Streamlining data governance & compliance with Microsoft Purview
✅ Unlocking seamless data integration & insights with Microsoft Fabric and Databases on Fabric
✅ Driving AI-powered automation with Agentic AI for real-time decision-making and task execution
✅ Elaboration with Real-world business use cases.

title: Accelerating Insights: Unleashing the Power of Streaming Data with Fabric Real-Time Hub
abstract:
Explore the future of data with the Fabric Real-Time hub: a comprehensive platform for Data Engineers and Analysts to seamlessly discover, connect, consume, and gain actional insights from a wide variety of real-time data sources. This session will unveil exciting new features designed to optimize the efficiency and capabilities of Data Engineers and Analysts, surpassing conventional solutions. Discover enhanced tools for advanced data analysis, streamlined actions for streams and KQL tables, and expanded Fabric event categories. Experience how our robust integrations with various data sources and Fabric Workloads can significantly elevate your data engineering capabilities.

Join us to understand how our sophisticated workflows quickly transform raw data into actionable insights, enabling more effective decision-making in real-time environments, and providing a more strategic solution than traditional real-time data management systems.

title: Accelerating Workloads with Microsoft Fabric and Azure Databricks
abstract: Get the most out of your investments with Microsoft Fabric and Azure Databricks. Learn how their deep integration accelerates workloads, optimizes performance, and maximizes value. Learn how the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform on Azure streamlines analytics and AI. Discover best practices for improving ETL performance, scaling efficiently, and unifying your data strategy to drive business impact.

title: Accelerating Your Microsoft Fabric Journey with AI: From Strategy to Value
abstract: Explore how AI can guide your transition to Microsoft Fabric, optimize your investment, and accelerate downstream AI initiatives. Learn how intelligent automation and data-driven insights can streamline migration, enhance scalability, and unlock the full potential of Fabric for your organization’s AI-driven future.

title: Accidental Azure DBA in 2025 Copilot is Your Toolkit
abstract:
In the rapidly evolving landscape of cloud computing, many IT professionals find themselves unexpectedly taking on the role of a Database Administrator (DBA) without formal training. This session, "Accidental Azure DBA in 2025 Copilot is your toolkit," is designed to equip these accidental DBAs with the essential knowledge and skills needed to manage and optimize your Azure SQL DB and Fabric SQL DB effectively.

We will begin by exploring the fundamental concepts of a DBA in the cloud. Next, we will delve into the how as an accidental DBA we can manage these concepts, such as performance tuning, security management, and backup and recovery with the help of Copilot. Through practical demonstrations and real-world examples, participants will learn how to monitor and optimize database performance using Azure's built-in tools and services.

By the end of this session, attendees will have confidence in knowing how copilot fits into their Azure DBA toolkit. Whether you are an IT professional who has recently been thrust into the DBA role or someone looking to expand your skill set, this session will provide you with the knowledge and practical skills needed to succeed.

Join us to find out how, in 2025, with the right toolkit, being an accidental Azure DBA is not as scary as you might think.

title: Adopting Microsoft Fabric: Medallion Architecture and Data Mesh Made Easy
abstract:
In this session, we will delve into two complementary approaches to adopting Microsoft Fabric: the horizontal approach through medallion architecture and the vertical approach through data mesh.

The horizontal approach will elaborate on how a medallion architecture can be implemented by leveraging Microsoft lakehouse and warehouse, using the data engineering tools. This architecture simplifies data management by organizing data into bronze, silver, and gold layers, ensuring data quality and accessibility at each stage. The bronze layer consists of raw data, the silver layer contains cleaned and enriched data, and the gold layer holds business-ready data. By structuring data in this way, organizations can streamline data processing, improve data governance, and enhance data analytics capabilities.

The vertical approach will focus on how data mesh allows organizations to better democratize and delegate access to a data platform like Microsoft Fabric. Data mesh decentralizes data ownership by promoting domain-oriented data management, where each domain is responsible for its own data products. This approach empowers teams to manage their own data, fostering innovation and agility. By implementing data mesh, organizations can break down data silos, improve data accessibility, and enable cross-functional collaboration, ultimately leading to more informed decision-making and faster time-to-insight.

This session will provide a well-detailed explanation of how leveraging these two approaches increases the likelihood of success when adopting and designing a data architecture in Microsoft Fabric. Attendees will gain invaluable insights and practical strategies to enhance their data initiatives and drive organizational growth.

title: Advanced RAG Architecture with PostgreSQL
abstract: The success of GenAI apps is decided by the accuracy of their responses. Using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), you can improve accuracy by grounding GenAI app responses in your data. In this session, explore advanced RAG techniques in Azure Database for PostgreSQL including new vector search algorithms, parameter tuning, hybrid search, semantic ranking, and the GraphRAG approach. See how you can use these techniques to deploy scalable and accurate GenAI apps in your enterprise.

title: Advanced Techniques in Data Warehouse Workload Management
abstract: Managing workloads at enterprise scale can be challenging. Fabric data warehouse is equipping you with the tools you need for success! Join us for this beyond the basics session on optimizing resource allocation, scalability, and data consistency for analytical workloads. Learn how burstable capacity is really applied in Fabric data warehouse and what levers you have to influence it. Boost performance in high concurrency scenarios and ensure users always access a stable reporting environment. don't miss this opportunity to level up your warehouse game!

title: An AI Agent to Automatically Tune Your Azure Database for MySQL Instances
abstract:
Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server has transformed database management by managing infrastructure, availability, data protection, and lifecycle patching, freeing developers and enterprises from these complexities. However, database performance tuning remains a customer-driven challenge, with direct impact on both end-user experience and business outcomes. Tuning MySQL, an open-source database with over 300 configuration parameters, can be daunting – requiring specialized expertise, experimentation, and extensive testing to get it right. With recent advancements in machine learning, automatic MySQL tuning is now within reach, offering optimized database performance with minimal effort and no database expertise required.

Join this dynamic, demo-led session to see how we leverage our internal ML-driven experimentation platform to select optimized parameter defaults, particularly for popular LAMP stack applications like Moodle. Discover how to enhance your MySQL workloads with AI-driven precision, ease and take your database performance to the next level. In this session, we will also showcase our latest innovations like Blue-Green deployments which will make change management in production environment stress-free for customers, along with Fabric Mirroring, a seamless no-ETL experience to integrate your existing MySQL database data with the rest of your data in Microsoft Fabric.

title: Announcing: User Data Functions in Fabric for Developer Flexibility Now in Public Preview!
abstract: Join us for an in-depth look at Python User Data Functions in Fabric with the product team! In this session we will provide a comprehensive view of how User Data Functions can be developed and used in Fabric. Learn how to implement common data applications, such as data cleaning, data validations, data transformation and CRUD operations into Fabric data sources. These solutions can simplify your data architectures and empower your developers to achieve higher scalability and reusability. Participants will also gain insights about the seamless integrations with Fabric Pipelines, Fabric Notebooks, Fabric Warehouses, Fabric SQL Databases and even Power BI reports, to build robust and flexible data applications. By the end of this session, attendees will be equipped with the knowledge and tools to drive innovation in their data solutions with the flexibility and power ​that Python User Data Functions can provide, with practical examples and use cases.

title: Automated Testing with DAX Query View and Git Integration
abstract: Are you struggling with managing issues in your semantic models/datasets? Would you like to conduct tests and easily share those tests with your team? In this session I show you a DAX Query View Testing Pattern. This pattern combines the new DAX Query View feature in Power BI Desktop, Azure DevOps, and DataOps principles to help you improve project delivery and reduce errors.

title: Automating CI/CD Processes in Microsoft Fabric: Best Practices and Latest Developments
abstract: Join us to explore the latest capabilities in Microsoft Fabric for establishing scalable and resilient release processes. We'll cover automated deployment patterns, E2E script-based deployments, environment-specific configurations, and highlight a new contribution in the open-source community. Gain practical insights into optimizing your process and learn about upcoming advancements. Whether you're a seasoned developer or just getting started, this session will equip you with the knowledge to streamline your CI/CD processes in Microsoft Fabric.

title: Avoiding the Analytic Danger Zone: Governing Power BI in the Age of Self-Service & AI
abstract:
The role of BI teams is rapidly evolving. As organizations embrace self-service analytics, traditional BI teams are shrinking, shifting their focus from visualization creation to managing data products and corporate reports. Meanwhile, self-service report development surges—especially with the rise of Copilot and AI—leading to an explosion of analytics assets without meaningful governance.

This creates an Analytic Danger Zone: a self-service landscape where reports, dashboards, and datasets proliferate without oversight, leading to redundancy, inconsistency, and compliance risks. Many Data & Analytics managers take proactive steps to bring order by implementing DevOps practices like GIT and Azure DevOps. While these tools excel for technical analysts, complementing them with strategies tailored for self-service analytics ensures a more comprehensive governance approach.

So, how can organizations govern Power BI effectively without stifling self-service innovation?

Join this session to explore:

✅ The shift from traditional BI to self-service and AI-driven analytics
✅ Enhancing Azure DevOps and GIT for zero-effort governance in self-service BI
✅ Practical strategies to gain control over the Power BI ecosystem without slowing down business users
✅ Moving from managing the process to managing the results

If you're a BI leader, data professional, or Power BI administrator navigating the chaos of self-service analytics, this session will equip you with actionable insights to bring governance to the ungoverned.

title: Azure Arc for SQL Server – Bring Cloud-Scale Management to Your On-Prem and Multi-Cloud SQL Estate
abstract: Discover how Azure Arc extends Azure management and services to SQL Server instances anywhere, providing a unified management platform that enhances visibility, security, and operational efficiency. Plus, learn more about how Azure Arc can help streamline your data migrations to Azure.

title: Azure SQL Database vs. SQL Database in Fabric: Key Differences for Developers and DBAs
abstract:
Curious about the differences between Azure SQL Database and SQL Database in Fabric? This intro-level session is perfect for developers and DBAs looking to understand the architecture and fundamentals of these two platforms.

In this session, you'll:

• Examine the core architecture and compute models of each platform.
• Compare options for scalability, high availability, and disaster recovery.
• Explore the different cost structures between the two solutions.

Whether you’re optimizing an existing solution or planning your next project, this session will help you make informed decisions and maximize the value of these services. Don't miss this opportunity to level up your cloud database knowledge!

title: Best Practices and Design Patterns for Fabric Data Factory
abstract:
In this session, we will share learnings from working with customers and partners. This session will cover best practices and design patterns for implementing end-to-end data integration solutions. You will learn tips and tricks and gotchas when designing data ingestion, data transformation, replication and orchestration work using Fabric Data Factory.

Learn how you can be successful with Data Factory pipelines, dataflows gen 2, copy job, mirroring, orchestration and more. Additionally, we will cover top of mind dataflow failures and folding mistakes that cause data flow performance delays and how to correct them. Join us in this session, as we share learnings, best practices, and design patterns that will enable you to be successful with Fabric Data Factory.

title: Best Practices to Speed Up AI Data Privacy Compliance in Fabric
abstract:
It’s no surprise that 95% of organizations are concerned about regulatory non-compliance in AI environments, according to the Perforce Delphix 2024 State of Data Compliance and Security Report.

At the same time the AI race is accelerating. How can you protect sensitive data and ensure privacy compliance without bottlenecking your AI and analytics initiatives or compromising data quality?

In this session, we’ll explore the key challenges of securing sensitive data during Fabric adoptions and AI initiatives. You’ll gain actionable best practices to overcome these hurdles, including how to:
• Automatically find and irreversibly mask sensitive data to avoid reidentification.
• Achieve petabyte-scale performance by integrating masking into ETL data flows.
• Ensure realism of masked data for quality AI and analytics outcomes.

Join experts from Perforce Delphix, PreludeSys, and enterprise leader, SPINX, to learn how you can protect sensitive data in AI and analytics during Fabric adoption without compromising speed or quality. No trade-offs necessary!

title:
Better Together: Informatica & Microsoft Fabric
The Path to Trusted High-Quality and Mastered Data
abstract:
Informatica, the ISV Design Partner of Microsoft Fabric, shares their blueprint to enterprise grade Analytics and generative AI with lessons learned from driving mission critical workloads for the world’s largest enterprises. Implementing a unified data management platform with Microsoft Fabric presents key challenges such as discovering and ingesting data across diverse sources in various modes, ensuring trusted governance and sensitive data controls, enabling data usage through data cleansing for high quality, and mastering data to create a 360-degree view. Informatica’s Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) a SaaS solution built on Azure and available as an Azure Native ISV Service, addresses these critical challenges for a Microsoft Fabric implementation resulting in reliable outcomes for your analytics and ai initiatives.

In this session you will learn how:

1. Leaders overcome challenges implementing Analytics and Generative AI across their organizations
2. To unlock the value of enterprise data with a trusted cloud data management platform like Informatica with Microsoft Fabric
3. The High Scale, high performant Informatica connectors for Microsoft Fabric ingest data from diverse sources to SQL, Lakehouse and Warehouse endpoints
4. Informatica’s native app for data profiling and data quality, provides an integrated experience for data professionals in Microsoft Fabric
5. To get a contextual 360-degree view of business-critical data and visualize and analyze in Microsoft Fabric
6. Informatica’s IDMC services address the needs of data professionals across the analytics and AI lifecycle

The strong integration of Informatica’s Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) and Microsoft Fabric enhances data, AI and Analytics creates a cohesive and comprehensive data management and analytics platform that enables collaboration among various data roles and facilitates streamlined data management with AI modeling and insights discovery.

title: Beyond BI: Elevating Power BI with Notebooks
abstract: For nearly a decade, Power BI has empowered organizations with actionable insights. Now, Microsoft Fabric elevates analytics to the next level with Notebooks, offering advanced capabilities such as ML, GenAI, GeoSpatial Analysis, and real-time streaming. In this session, discover how Fabric Notebooks revolutionize analytics by providing deeper insights and enabling the next generation of reporting. Unlock unparalleled value from your data and redefine decision-making for your organization.

title: Bringing Data to OneLake: A Deep Dive into Shortcuts and Mirroring
abstract: With the massive growth in the volume of data and data sources, managing an entire organization-wide data estate is becoming increasingly complex. This session will deep dive into the latest capabilities of Shortcut and Mirroring to help unifying your data estate in OneLake, Fabric’s multi-cloud data lake. Join us to discover how ingesting data with Shortcut and Mirroring into OneLake can help you manage your data estate and unlock deeper insights.

title: Build, Automate and Deploy Decisions Faster With SAS® Decision Builder
abstract: Join Kumar Thangamuthu, Senior Product Manager at SAS, to explore how SAS Decision Builder on Microsoft Fabric helps you build, automate and deploy decisions faster. Learn how to use all of your Fabric data in your decisions; create decisions using business rules, Python code and machine learning models; and automate critical business workflows. This session will show you how to use SAS Decision Builder to be more productive, simplify decision making and align it with your business goals, helping you drive better outcomes in industries like banking, retail, manufacturing and health care.

title: Building Agentic AI Solutions Using AI Foundry and Fabric
abstract:
In this session, OmniData (now Fresche Solutions), will share our journey as early pioneers navigating implementations of Microsoft Fabric and Azure AI Foundry to address real Agentic AI use cases from a business and technical perspective.

Attendees will learn how to overcome the technical challenges, the practical solutions, and business value of implementing Agentic AI solutions using Fabric and AI Foundry. We’ll address use cases across various industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, and financial services.

Not sure where Fabric fits in? Check out our Fabric in Action workshop, a complimentary assessment to help you get started with confidence.

What Attendees Can Expect to Learn:
- Insights into various real-world use cases solved through Agentic AI flows
- The business value and benefits of integrating Microsoft Fabric with Azure AI Foundry
- The advantages of being early adopters and building cutting-edge solutions using Microsoft Fabric
- The technical challenges when designing Agentic AI solutions using Microsoft Fabric and Azure AI Foundry
- Practical examples of solutions in manufacturing and other industries

title: Building Fabric-native Experiences & Workloads to Power AI Transformation
abstract: Microsoft Fabric has continued to grow as the platform of choice for analytics and apps for data engineers, data scientists and app developers. In this session, discover how industry-leading ISVs and partners can integrate into Microsoft Fabric including build their own Fabric workloads to leverage the strength of the Fabric ecosystem. The session will also feature a high-level demo of Fabric’s Workload Development Kit and provide monetization guidance via Azure Marketplace and real-world examples of partner workloads in Fabric.

title: Building Intelligent Semantic Layer with Azure Cosmos DB and Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
As GPT-powered applications and copilot tools become integral to modern solutions, the creation of semantic layers over databases has become essential. This session explores how semantic layers can enhance GPT models' understanding of complex datasets by incorporating business context, thereby improving the accuracy and relevance of generated responses.

We will demonstrate how to mirror databases into Microsoft Fabric's analytics zones, enabling seamless integration of diverse data sources for advanced analytics and insights. In microservice-based architectures, teams often leverage varied databases such as Azure SQL and Azure Cosmos DB. While the copilot application might primarily interact with Cosmos DB, we will showcase how Microsoft Fabric’s OneLake can unify these data silos by creating combined views across disparate sources, facilitating real-time analytics and robust BI reporting.

Attendees will gain practical insights into building real-time semantic layers on Azure Cosmos DB using the change feed, ensuring GPT models remain context-aware and updated. Additionally, we will illustrate methods to integrate supplementary data sources into Microsoft Fabric, creating enriched datasets tailored for copilot applications and business intelligence needs.

title: Building SQL Databases in Fabric for Dashboards and Datamarts: Design, Indexing, and Compression
abstract: SQL database in Fabric can be an excellent solution for your datamart or to support your dashboard. However, to keep those dashboards and reports running smoothly, you must optimize your database design and indexing strategies. In this session, you will learn about the best practices for designing and building a star schema database in SQL database and how to structure your database. You will understand how to use columnstore indexes, and data compression and when to use heaps to make data ingest go faster. Whether you are an old DBA or a new data engineer, you will learn a lot in this demo-filled session.

title: Building Smart Applications with Fabric SQL Databases and Azure AI
abstract:
Join us to explore the capabilities of Fabric SQL Databases and discover how to harness their potential for building AI-powered applications. This engaging session will cover:

- Understanding Fabric Databases: What they are and why they are essential
- Step-by-step guide to setting up Fabric SQL Databases
- Connecting your database to AI services for real-time insights
- Live demo showcasing a real-world application built on Fabric DB with AI-driven recommendations
- Case studies of Fabric DB use cases across different industries to highlight its versatility and impact

Whether you're looking to enhance your database skills or integrate AI to boost your application's performance, this session provides the knowledge and tools you need.

title: Building a Fortress of Your Fabric Environment: Best Practices for Data Engineers
abstract:
Microsoft Fabric is a powerful, all-in-one analytics solution for enterprises that integrates data movement, real-time analytics, data science, and business intelligence. As data engineers, securing this environment is essential to protect sensitive data while maintaining efficiency. Microsoft Fabric, as a SaaS platform, offers robust built-in security features that simplify this task.

In this session, we’ll dive into the key security features and practices you can leverage to strengthen your Fabric environment. We’ll discuss the latest available security options, including private links for inbound access to Fabric and its artifacts, Trusted Workspace, Managed VNets with outbound Private Endpoints for external resources and how users can authenticate, ensuring your data remains secure.

By the end of this session, you’ll have a comprehensive understanding of the out-of-the-box security features of Microsoft Fabric, as well as the best practices to implement for maintaining a resilient and secure data environment.

This knowledge will help your organization safeguard its data, enhance operational efficiency, and build a secure foundation for future growth. After this session you are ready to build your own Fortress.

title: Building a Metadata-Driven Framework with Fabric SQL Database and Data Factory
abstract:
Efficient data management is a cornerstone of modern organizations, and leveraging the right tools can make all the difference. This session will explore how to harness the capabilities of the Fabric SQL Database to build a robust metadata-driven framework.

You will gain hands-on experience through a live demonstration, showcasing how to set up and configure the framework. We will cover best practices for metadata management, including creating and maintaining control tables, automating data workflows, and ensuring data integrity.

By the end of the session, attendees will have a comprehensive understanding of how to build and deploy a metadata-driven framework that can scale with their organization's needs. All code used during the demo will be shared afterwards, so you can start building a framework directly after the session.

Some of the highlights:

Live setup and configuration of a metadata-driven framework.
Step-by-step guide to creating and maintaining control tables.
Automation of data workflows using Data Factory.
Ensuring data integrity throughout the process.
Managing data pipelines using Fabric SQL Database.
Utilizing Notebook in Fabric for enhanced data management.
Taking advantage of Copliot to explain the Pipeline and write queries in the SQL Database.

This session is ideal for data engineers, database administrators, and IT professionals looking to enhance their data management capabilities. Whether you're new to metadata-driven frameworks or looking to refine your existing processes, this session will provide valuable insights and practical knowledge.

title: Building an AI-Ready Data Foundation with OneLake: A Practitioner's Blueprint
abstract:
Generative AI has evolved from a buzzword into a critical tool for solving enterprise challenges. Yet, operationalizing AI at scale presents key hurdles: preparing data for AI and having the data infrastructure to support production use cases.

This session provides a technical roadmap for overcoming these challenges. In collaboration with Interloop—a Fivetran customer, solution partner, and Microsoft Fabric ISV—we will explore the role of open table formats, technical catalogs, and practical solutions to safeguard sensitive data in AI applications. You will gain insights into Interloop’s extensive experience of productionizing OneLake and the Fivetran Managed Data Lake Service to create a universal storage layer, delivering AI-ready data and enabling the transition of generative AI use cases from experimentation to production.

Attendees will gain insights into:
- Leveraging Fivetran’s Managed Data Lake Service to simplify data consolidation and ensure compliance with GDPR and HIPAA.
- Utilizing Microsoft Fabric and OneLake for seamless scalability and governance across cloud environments.
- Integrating with modern open table formats like Delta Lake and Iceberg for enhanced analytics and AI performance.
- Addressing key challenges in scaling AI/ML initiatives, such as security, data readiness, and time-to-value acceleration.

title: Business Performance Analytics & Fabric: Expedite Data Modeling for D365
abstract: This session will provide a detailed overview and comparison of Microsoft Dynamics Business Performance Analytics (BPA) Fabric Extensibility, Fabric Link, and Synapse Link (into Fabric via shortcuts), focusing on their applicability to Dynamics 365 scenarios. Attendees will learn about the strengths, limitations, and best use cases for each integration option, helping them determine the right approach for their specific business needs based on real world experiences. The session will include practical insights on performance, scalability, and ease of implementation, empowering organizations to make informed decisions when building their data integration strategies using Microsoft Fabric.

title: Changing the Way We Interact with Data in the Era of AI
abstract:
Why should we look at reports and search for a specific KPI, if you can just ask your personal assistant for the most recent status of that KPI? Chatting is the new way of interacting with your data in the Era of AI.

Join us as we delve into the future of data interaction and explore the transformative power of Microsoft Fabric. Discover how this technology enables us to have dynamic conversations with our data that go beyond traditional static reports. Unlock not only your warehouses, but also your semantic models and other data sources through the power of interactive chatbots in a revolutionary fashion. During this demo rich session, you will see Fabric AI Skills and Microsoft CoPilot live in action!

During this session we will touch upon different technologies to support your data related conversations
- Natural language to SQL capabilities
- MS Copilot in Power BI
- AI Skills in MS Fabric
- Power Virtual Agents to bring conversations to MS Teams

title: Choosing Between Import Mode, DirectLake, and Composite Models
abstract:
Semantic models in Fabric can use DirectLake as a storage option. However, every choice has pros and cons considering the entire lifecycle of an analytical solution. Processing time and query performance are only a few of the parameters to consider. For example, agility in modifying the semantic model to satisfy specific reporting requirements is usually underestimated in the initial evaluation, but it can have a large impact in development time and deployment latency.

Composite models can combine different storage engines and provide a better solution in several scenarios. For example, by combining Import mode and DirectLake, or by just extending a Directlake model without requiring an additional effort to the data engineering team.

This session explores the options available, introducing the composite models with DirectLake data sources.

title: Choosing the Right Data Store--An Overview of Azure Data Platform Choices
abstract: Choosing the right data store can make or break the performance and costs of your application. In this session, you will learn about all the options available to you in the Azure Data Platform. You'll learn about CosmosDB, Azure SQL Database, Azure Postgres and MySQL services, as well as Databricks and HDInsight. You will also learn how to leverage caching to reduce the overall workload on your data tier. We will discuss the notion of polyglot persistence, storing different data in different data stores with the goal of optimizing your overall data architecture, for flexibility and performance.

title: Code, Collaborate, Accelerate: The New Era of Power BI Development
abstract:
The landscape of enterprise-scale Power BI development has never been more thrilling! With recent innovations, Power BI has opened new doors for developers to work smarter and faster.

- Dive into developer mode, where intuitive file formats like TMDL and PBIR empower you to seamlessly manage metadata for semantic models and reports.

- Explore Fabric’s robust APIs, enabling automated deployments and the creation of powerful CI/CD pipelines, streamlining workflows like never before.

- Leverage Fabric workspace git integration to maintain version control and collaborate efficiently on your projects.

- Discover how the TMDL Extension for Visual Studio Code and TMDL View deliver a "semantic model as code" experience, revolutionizing how you design and maintain models. With Copilot integration, streamline essential but time-consuming modeling tasks for maximum efficiency and precision.

Join us to uncover these game-changing features, learn how to elevate your Power BI development capabilities, and get an exclusive sneak peek into what’s next from the Power BI product team.

Whether you’re a seasoned pro or just starting, this session is your gateway to mastering the future of Power BI development!

title: Come As You Are! Enabling Data Science & AI for All Levels with Fabric
abstract:
Organisations of all shapes and sizes are striving for their data science and AI revolution. However, with skills being scarce and costly, the ability to approach data science and AI capabilities is critical!

This session will cover all the ways a user of the Fabric ecosystem can tackle data science and AI use cases, ranging from forecasting and AI visuals in Power BI, through AutoML and industry solutions, all the way to custom machine learning with notebooks and MLFlow. Each experience will be articulated with demos and anecdotal examples, highlighting the flexibility of the Fabric platform.

The ideal audience for this session will be data analysts, engineers and scientists looking to establish a suitable approach to AI, machine learning or data science that fits their capabilities. Attendees will leave this session with a clear understanding of the different options for delivering advanced analytics capabilities, and the types of use cases that can be delivered.

title: Configuring and Customizing Power BI Copilot Roadmap
abstract: Join this session to get a first look into the roadmap of Copilot configuration and curation investments. Get a glimpse into upcoming capabilities for how your organization can configure Power BI copilot to meet your needs. This session will provide you with valuable insights into future capabilities that will allow you to take full advantage of AI to elevate your data, and ensure you stay at the forefront of technological advancements in business intelligence.

title: Ctrl+Data: Fabric’s Blueprint for Reusable Pipelines
abstract:
Discover how to combine the new parameterizable connections with Fabrics SQL Databases to build platform-native, metadata-driven Data Pipelines. This approach enhances reusability and reduces the number of artifacts that require maintenance. By separating code from configuration, you can additionally increase operational efficiency.

This session will show you the possibilities that these features offer, providing you with practical examples and insights. Additionally, you’ll benefit from expert guidance on best practices for designing parameterized pipelines, ensuring that you create systems that are not only powerful but also scalable and adaptable to evolving data needs. Join us to elevate your data workflows and harness the expertise needed to implement robust pipeline architectures.

title: Cultivating a Culture of Inclusivity: Actionable Strategies for DEI Excellence
abstract:
In today's rapidly evolving data and technology landscape, fostering a culture of inclusivity is not just a moral imperative but a strategic advantage. This session explores actionable strategies to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) into the core of your organization. Attendees will gain practical insights into creating an environment where diverse voices thrive, collaboration flourishes, and innovation is amplified.

Join us to explore frameworks tailored for the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem, focusing on the unique roles and contributions of Data Engineers, Scientists, Analysts, and IT Professionals. Together, we will uncover how DEI initiatives can empower your team to overcome challenges, foster resilience, and achieve transformative results.

The audience will leave with:
1. Practical Frameworks: Learn to implement DEI principles using actionable strategies for diverse data-centric teams.
2. Enhanced Collaboration: Discover methods to promote inclusion and equity in cross-functional teams.
3. DEI Metrics: Understand how to measure and communicate the impact of inclusivity within data ecosystems.
4. Leadership Insights: Equip leaders with tools to advocate for and sustain a culture of inclusivity.
5. Innovative Solutions: Explore case studies demonstrating how DEI drives creativity and innovation in tech organizations.

title: Customer Stories -  Sharing Experiences: Scaling with Microsoft Fabric
abstract: Please join LSEG and PGIM as they share their experiences with implementing Fabric for their organizations.

title: Customer Stories - Sharing Experiences with Microsoft Fabric in Healthcare
abstract: Please join UNC Health and Queensland Nurses and Midwives Union as they share their experiences in implementing Fabric in the Healthcare Industry.

title: Customer Stories - Sharing Experiences with Power BI Copilot
abstract: Please join EY and Wolters Kluwer for a panel-style discussion on learnings and experiences with Power BI Copilot.

title: Customer Stories - Sharing Experiences: Getting Started with Fabric Databases
abstract: Please join Save the Children and Aon for a panel-style discussion on their experience with Fabric Databases.

title: Data Discovery with Organizational Apps and Metric Sets
abstract: Let’s get the right data into business users’ hands. In Public Preview today, Organizational Apps and Metrics help data teams to more easily distribute and maintain their data assets. Join the product team for demos of the latest available functionality, previews of upcoming enhancements, and Copilot integrations. Learn how to bridge the gap between the business and IT to promote consistent decision-making in your organization.

title: Data Engineering with Spark for SQL Server Professionals
abstract: As organizations modernize their data landscape, many are adopting Spark for data engineering and ETL. In this session you'll get a basic overview of building data transformations in Spark, targeted at the SQL Server professional. Learn to leverage your SQL skills to build set-based transformations with deferred execution and caching on the modern, scalable Spark platform.

title: Data Factory: Beyond the Basics
abstract:
Dataflows Gen2 provide best-in-class experiences around Data Ingestion & Transformation, enabling users ranging from Pro to Citizen Developers to ingest, transform and load data from any data source, shape and size into Fabric data items or other destinations beyond Fabric.

Join this session with the Dataflows product team to learn more about current and upcoming capabilities in Dataflows Gen2.

title: Data Modeling in Direct Lake
abstract:
In this session, we'll dive into Direct Lake, the new Power BI storage mode that seamlessly blends DirectQuery's real-time capabilities and Import mode's performance.

We unravel how this promising technology impacts traditional data modeling approaches, answering essential questions on star schemas, surrogate keys, SCDs, and other classical dimensional modeling techniques and best practices in relation to Direct Lake.

This session equips you with a deeper understanding of the Direct Lake landscape and its implications for data modeling, empowering you to craft performant data models.

The key areas we'll explore are:

- Overview of Direct Lake
- Impact of Direct Lake on data modeling techniques
- Redefining data transformation strategies

title: Dataverse, Power Platform and Fabric Two-Way Integration: Real-Time and Secure
abstract: Getting real-time insights from Dynamics365 and PowerApps data in Dataverse is easier than ever. Fabric Link to Dataverse is near-real-time and more secure - updating data within a few minutes. Dataverse mirroring in Microsoft Fabric makes it even easier to get access to Dynamics and Power Apps data for authorized users. Using combined data from Dataverse and OneLake, you can drive action with Power Apps and Power pages. Attend this session to hear about latest developments directly from the product team and see lots of end to end demos.

title: Decrease Cost and Management Effort with Fabric SQL DB
abstract:
Businesses today want well designed databases which can be used not only by applications but are part of an analytical solution which allows people to interact visually with the data in reports. Are you interested in decreasing and centralizing your Azure costs while continuing to support applications which need a SQL database? Are you interested in migrating an on-premises SQL Server database to the cloud or move away from decentralized manage instance databases? Fabric SQL DB can be the solution as it provides the ability to combine SQL Server functionality with Business Intelligence Analysis.

For many existing applications, having a SQL Database is a requirement. We will review the processes for doing maintenance for SQL DB inside of Microsoft Fabric, focusing on the “knob free” methods to minimize the steps involved and migration from an on prem database. We will examine the different cost models to demonstrate how this solution can be used to minimize costs and decrease management effort through automated maintenance and centralized resource monitoring.

This session will provide you with the use cases to determine when and why an SQL DB inside of Fabric can benefit your data environment.

title: Deep Dive into Direct Lake
abstract: Join Patrick Leblanc and Phil Seamark for a deeper dive to discover what makes Direct Lake so fast. This session will cover important elements of monitoring and optimizing your Fabric data platform to unlock the full potential of Direct Lake, such as how to interpret Delta Analyzer logs and what to look out for if things slow down.

title: Deep Dive on OneLake Data Security
abstract:
Join us for an in-depth session on security in OneLake and how it can provide precise control over data access within OneLake and Microsoft Fabric. We will delve into how data access can be managed through OneLake security, shifting the permissions management from each compute engine to the data lake itself.
The session will take an in-depth look at new security features available in OneLake. We’ll review the existing object level security features and highlight key updates and changes from the new release. Next, learn all about the new features of row and column level security. We will give practical examples showing how these features work and where to leverage them in your organization.
We’ll explore the two main integration patterns for Fabric engines: delegated and passthrough. We’ll discuss the tradeoffs of each pattern, and situations for using one over the other. For SQL Endpoint and Semantic models we will explore their existing permissions and how that layers over OneLake security.
Furthermore, we will examine the use of shortcuts in Microsoft Fabric to simplify data management and discuss the special security considerations required for different types of shortcuts.
This session is a must-attend for data professionals seeking to enhance their understanding and implementation of OneLake's comprehensive security model. Equip yourself with the knowledge to safeguard your data and ensure compliance with organizational security policies.

title: Deep Insights in Your Microsoft Fabric Landscape with FUAM
abstract: One important bit of the Microsoft Fabric adoption roadmap is System oversight. In this session, we will have a look into what is possible to Monitor and Audit your Fabric Landscape. We will look into the out of the box functionality, what is on the roadmap and we will deep-dive in more advanced functionality by using the Fabric Unified Admin Monitoring Framework (FUAM). This comprehensive framework will include data from different APIs, Capcity Management App, Best Practise - and Vertipaq Analyzer to build an outstanding monitoring solution. We will show live monitoring possibilities with FUAM and our experience by using it in large Fabric landscapes.

title: Design Patterns for Scalable Multi-agent Applications with Azure Cosmos DB
abstract:
In this session, we'll explore design patterns for developing scalable multi-agent applications. We'll focus on leveraging Azure Cosmos DB as the single database to manage agent transactional data, operational application data, vector embeddings, text data, and more! We'll see why Azure Cosmos DB is the database of choice for any-scale AI apps.

Key topics include:

Agent-to-Agent Transactions: Discover methods to facilitate seamless and efficient transactions between agents, ensuring data consistency and reliability.

Statefulness: Learn how to maintain state across interactions, enabling agents to remember and build upon previous exchanges.

Chat History: Explore techniques for storing and retrieving chat histories, allowing agents to provide contextually relevant responses.

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): Understand how to implement patterns like vector Search with DiskANN for low-latency, highly scalable vector search, and Hybrid Search to enhance the relevancy of agent contexts and responses.

Function Calling: Learn how to enable structured queries from Cosmos DB to expand scenarios beyond simple RAG approaches.

Multitenancy: See how to support multitenant applications, ensuring data isolation and security for different users or clients.

Scalability: Examine features that handle large volumes of data and high-throughput workloads with Azure Cosmos DB's Dynamic Autoscale, which is essential for multi-agent systems.

title: Direct Lake Best Practices and Lessons Learned from the Past Year
abstract: In this session, we will discuss when to use Direct Lake and explore best practices for utilizing this capability in MS Fabric. We will also cover strategies to maximize its effectiveness. As a Subject Matter Expert, I will share my experiences and lessons learned from implementing Direct Lake for clients with large-scale data use cases.

title: Discovering Unknown Unknowns with AI and Real-Time Intelligence
abstract: Real-time intelligence is crucial for businesses aiming to stay competitive in a fast-paced world. In this session, we will explore how to leverage the latest tools in real-time inteligence to extract actionable insights from streaming data and set up anomaly detection alerts. We’ll dive into practical techniques for setting up robust real-time data pipelines, discuss key metrics for monitoring, and cover best practices for ensuring data quality and scalability.

title: Driving a Data-Driven Culture with Power BI in Microsoft 365
abstract: Discover what’s new and upcoming for Power BI integration with M365! Learn how to drive productivity and deepen your organization’s data-driven culture. In this session we will walk through what’s available in Power BI today, what’s on the roadmap, and how you can use these features to increase efficiency and improve decision making!

title: Effortless Data Mirroring: Connecting Microsoft Fabric and Snowflake for Unified Analytics
abstract:
In a rapidly evolving data landscape, businesses rely on seamless data synchronization to harness the power of hybrid analytics platforms. This paper presents a robust approach to data mirroring between Microsoft Fabric and Snowflake, enabling consistent and real-time data availability across both systems.

We explore the integration methodologies that utilize Microsoft Fabric's analytics capabilities alongside Snowflake's high-performance data warehousing. Key techniques such as Change Data Capture (CDC), event-driven pipelines, and API-based orchestration are examined to ensure low-latency and fault-tolerant data replication.

This work highlights practical applications in scenarios like enterprise reporting, dynamic dashboarding, and multi-cloud data strategies. By enabling organizations to bridge these powerful platforms, the proposed mirroring solutions empower real-time insights and a unified view of data, driving operational excellence and strategic innovation.

title: Effortless SAP Data Integration into Microsoft Fabric – Unlock Insights in Real Time
abstract: SAP data extraction for analytics has never been easier. In this session, we’ll showcase our SAP-certified integration with Microsoft Fabric, enabling seamless, real-time data replication for advanced analytics and reporting. Learn how to streamline SAP data workflows, leverage pre-built models, and gain actionable insights effortlessly. Led by experts from dab, with 20+ years in SAP data extraction, this session includes a live demonstration and best practices for integrating SAP with Microsoft’s data ecosystem.

title: Elevating Data Quality: Solutions with Microsoft Fabric and Purview
abstract:
One of the biggest hurdles in data analytics projects is ensuring high data quality (DQ). Poor DQ can originate from unreliable source systems or the lack of robust business logic and requirements, resulting in inaccurate insights and delayed project timelines.
In this session, we’ll explore how Microsoft Fabric simplifies the DQ process with its built-in capabilities and how public frameworks can further streamline implementation. You’ll also see how Microsoft Purview’s latest DQ features integrate with Microsoft Fabric to enable consistent monitoring and governance across lakehouses, warehouses, and semantic models.
By the end of the session, you’ll know how to:
• Leverage Microsoft Fabric’s DQ features for real-world projects.
• Implement and adapt public frameworks for your use case.
• Know how and where to check for DQ issues in your Microsoft Fabric data preparation pipelines.
• Utilize Microsoft Purview to enhance data governance and quality management.
Whether you’re a data engineer, analyst, or architect, this session equips you with practical knowledge and tools to elevate your data quality strategy with Microsoft’s ecosystem.

title: Elevating Developer Experience in Fabric Warehouse: Unleashing the Next Wave of Innovation
abstract:
Explore how Microsoft Fabric Warehouse is redefining the developer experiences! This session highlights the exciting innovations and feature upgrades that are reshaping how developers work with data.
Uncover the power of Warehouse Shortcuts in OneLake, offering effortless unification of data across domains, clouds, and accounts to create a truly virtual data lake. Dive into the transformative capabilities of Dimensional Data Models with Entity Relationship Diagrams to better organize, optimize, and empower consumption of your data. Explore the game-changing integration of AI and Copilot, designed to supercharge productivity, and learn about SSMS 21 compatibility, bringing your favorite tools into the Fabric Warehouse ecosystem. We’ll also cover enhanced CI/CD workflows, powerful Query Editor features, and the versatility of T-SQL Notebooks for complex query management and documentation.
Get ready to embrace a smarter, faster, and more intuitive way to work in Fabric Warehouse. Don’t miss this opportunity to get ahead of the curve!

title: Empower Enterprise Insights with Microsoft Fabric and Multi-Agent Systems
abstract:
In this session, we demonstrate how to use multi-agent systems with Microsoft Fabric to provide automated insights and solutions to complex business requests. We leverage next generation of AutoGen combined with Microsoft Fabric's OneLake Data Lakehouse and GraphQL API, to enable seamless integration of enterprise data into agentic decision-making, providing flexibility for complex enterprise data insight tasks. Examples of problems this solution can solve include:
• Using AI-native workflow automation to simplify business processes.
• Automate the resolution of Data Governance requirements for data discovery and access control.
• Auto-detect security threats and system vulnerabilities impacting the business.

Key Points:
• Learn how to build a multi-agent system to solve complex business problems.
• Connecting a multi-agent system with Microsoft Fabric OneLake Data Lakehouse.
• End-to-end architecture and demo of using multi-agent system with Microsoft Fabric.

Agenda:
• Address complex business problems with multi-agent applications.
• Seamlessly integrate multi-agent systems using OneLake's GraphQL RESTful API.
• Develop robust diagnostic pipelines on CoreOS.
• Enhance your applications by integrating with Open WebUI pipeline plugins.
• Ensure security with network isolation and Azure Entra identity management.
• Use Azure Container Apps to deploy and manage containers efficiently.
• Implement advanced AI operations using Bicep for streamlined deployment and management

Technical concepts:
AutoGenNext, Actor Design Pattern, Microsoft Fabric OneLake GraphQL RESTful API, CoreOS, Microsoft Fabric Pipelines, Azure Bicep, Agentic AIOps

title: Empower Your Workflow: Building and Deploying Machine Learning Models in Fabric
abstract:
In this session, we’ll explore how to seamlessly build and deploy end-to-end machine learning models within Microsoft Fabric, catering to users of all skill levels—whether you’re a data analyst, data scientist, or data engineer. Discover new capabilities, including Data Wrangler for data preparation, AutoML for streamlined model training and tuning, and Model Endpoints for effortless deployment and integration.

Through live demonstrations and practical examples, you’ll learn how to go from raw data to deployed machine learning solutions, leveraging Fabric’s unified analytics platform. By the end of this session, you’ll be equipped with the tools and knowledge to enhance your ML workflows, reduce complexity, and deliver impactful insights faster.

title: Empowering Data Citizens with Microsoft Fabric: From Self-Service BI to Data Mesh
abstract:
Microsoft Fabric is revolutionizing the way organizations approach governance, innovation, and collaboration in data-driven environments. Designed for Data Citizens, Fabric combines the simplicity of low-code tools with the rigor of state-of-the-art data development practices, enabling users to create complete, enterprise-grade data assets without technical compromises.
This session will explore how Fabric empowers users to discover, reuse, promote, and govern data assets they have built with integrated tools like Microsoft PurView and OneLake Catalog. These features not only streamline data cataloging and governance but also foster trust and collaboration across teams and enterprises.
Additionally, we’ll discuss how Fabric supports modern architectures like Data Mesh. By decentralizing data ownership and enabling self-service analytics, Data Mesh ensures that Data Citizens are at the center of scalable, governed, and innovative data platforms.
With practical demos and actionable insights, this session showcases how Microsoft Fabric’s low-code capabilities and modern governance tools help organizations scale analytics, foster collaboration, and maintain technical excellence in today’s dynamic data landscape.

title: Enabling Machine Learning Workflows in Microsoft Fabric: Beyond Power BI with Semantic Link
abstract:
Microsoft Fabric has emerged as a powerful platform in the Machine Learning (ML) and AI space, addressing common challenges organisations face in starting with ML and productionising models. In this session, we’ll explore how Fabric simplifies end-to-end Data Science workflows, focusing on Semantic Link, a transformative feature for SMBs and enterprises alike. By accessing and synchronising Power BI semantic models to OneLake through Semantic Link, businesses can unlock advanced analytics without needing an extensive data warehouse

We’ll demonstrate how to implement the theoretical Data Science Process in Fabric. Starting with the ideation and hypothesis phase, we’ll showcase data discovery of Semantic models using OneLake Catalog and explore options for synchronising Semantic Models, highlighting trade-offs in integration approaches and access methods.

For data exploration and modelling, we’ll use SynapseML to apply built-in GenAI for product segmentation, translation, and supplier reliability classification, enabled by Azure OpenAI. Next, we’ll prepare data models for low-code AutoML tasks like financial forecasting, showcasing its accessibility for new teams and efficiency for scientists. Finally, we’ll showcase a scalable product recommendation system based on financial data, applicable across industries.

To provide actionable insights, models must be effectively deployed. We’ll demonstrate how to integrate the model lifecycle with your data pipeline, ensuring predictions remain relevant while monitoring trends and performance. Without a consumable layer, however, these models can’t deliver value. We’ll show how to serve predictions through Power BI semantic models and reports while seamlessly integrating them into external applications using Fabric’s shortcuts, SQL, or GraphQL as well.

By the end of this session, you’ll learn to implement end-to-end ML workflows in Fabric, from hypothesis to deployment, and integrate insights into Power BI and beyond. Join us to see how Fabric simplifies ML workflows and drives impactful results with Semantic Link!

title: End to End Supply Chain & Operations Platform on Microsoft Fabric
abstract: Supply chains are more fluid than ever before. Having a supply chain operations platform that can handle the nuances of existing data siloes enabled with real-time visibility can make a multi-million-dollar impact if leveraged correctly. Introducing EY's Supply Chain Operations platform on Microsoft Fabric with Real-Time Intelligence. Learn how EY is using the SC&O platform to enhance product quality, service levels, cost savings, intelligent decision-making, transparency, and sustainability.

title: Enhance the Quality of Your Data and AI Solutions with Real-Time Intelligence
abstract: In today’s fast-paced, AI-driven digital landscape, real-time decision-making hinges on maintaining impeccable data quality in the face of high-volume, high-velocity data. Join us at this session to learn about the comprehensive capabilities offered by Fabric Real-Time Intelligence services to proactively detect, correct and act on any data quality issues. This interactive session will delve into the end-to-end features including schema management and enforcement, data preview, and filtering and conditional routing in Eventstreams, and advanced anomaly detection and alerting functionalities provided by Eventhouse and Activator. Discover how these powerful features can help you achieve your business goals with confidence.

title: Enhancing Data Governance with Microsoft Fabric and Microsoft Purview
abstract:
In today’s data-driven world, organizations must strike a balance between accessibility and compliance. Microsoft Fabric, integrated with Microsoft Purview, offers a comprehensive governance solution that ensures data quality, compliance, and security across your data ecosystem. This session explores how Fabric and Purview work together to empower organizations to manage their data effectively, establish robust policies, and ensure compliance with regulatory frameworks like GDPR and CCPA.

The session will show how to implement data classification, sensitivity labeling, and lineage tracking across diverse data sources. Additionally, the session will delve into real-world scenarios where governance automation reduces risk and fosters trust in analytics. Whether you're just beginning your data governance journey or looking to refine existing strategies, this session will equip you with the knowledge and tools to build a governance framework tailored to your organization’s needs.

title: Enhancing E-commerce with AI: Integrating with Azure Functions, Activator and Azure AI Search
abstract:
This session explores how to revolutionize e-commerce operations by integrating Magento with Azure Functions and leveraging Azure MySQL as the backbone database. Attendees will learn how to automate order updates using Azure Functions, reducing manual effort and streamlining operations. The session also dives into how AI-powered tools can enhance personalized customer experiences through tailored product recommendations and targeted marketing strategies. Additionally, the integration of Power BI with Activator and Azure MySQL will be showcased, enabling proactive decision-making through real-time triggers and actionable insights into key metrics like order statuses, revenue trends, and customer behavior.
Designed for developers, data scientists, data analysts, data citizens, and IT professionals, this session provides practical insights into building a seamless, end-to-end solution powered by Magento, Azure MySQL, and AI. By the end of the session, attendees will be equipped to enhance operations, improve customer satisfaction, and drive profitability in the e-commerce landscape.

title: Enterprise Scale - Administer and Govern Fabric with Ease
abstract: Discover the future of enterprise-scale administration and governance with Microsoft Fabric. This session will showcase the latest capabilities and features designed to simplify the administration, management and governance of Fabric at an enterprise level. Learn about our vision for admin controls and how existing tools and new enhancements can help you maintain control and compliance while leveraging the full potential of the platform. Get timely updates on the latest developments and best practices for administering Fabric, ensuring your organization can effectively manage its digital infrastructure

title: Event-Based Architectures Responding in Real-Time with Fabric Events
abstract:
Do you want to know immediately when a new file has been added to OneLake? Are you interested in knowing when a job status has changed?
Changes are happening all around you all the time. Fabric Events makes it easy to listen to those events and take action on them.
Join us to see how Fabric Events is providing access to changes across your Fabric estate and how you can streamline your workloads to react to them in real-time.

title: Experience the Power of SQL and Power BI with Microsoft Fabric
abstract: Everyone is talking about Microsoft Fabric – a whole new way of thinking about your organization’s data. While Fabric has been focused on Analytics, Microsoft SQL has not been left behind. In this session we’ll be talking about the different ways that you can integrate and replicate your Microsoft SQL data in near real time and experience into the Fabric, and how to leverage the two platforms to better achieve your business goals including the beauty of Power BI We will also show you new experiences with the Fabric for your database and application development. It is SQL vs Guy in a Cube for this session, so you never know what surprise guest might just show up!

title: Exploring Real-Time Horizons with Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
Blast off into the future of analytics with this interstellar session on real-time data processing in Microsoft Fabric!

From setting up KQL databases to capturing data streams from the International Space Station (yes, really!), this session is packed with hands-on tips and tricks. You'll explore how to harness the power of Event Streams and Logic Apps to create a seamless data pipeline that fuels real-time Power BI reports.

Discover the basics of KQL—spoiler alert, it’s not SQL! Learn to query data like a tabular astronaut, watching your dashboards come to life with up-to-the-minute updates. With step-by-step guidance and plenty of cosmic creativity, you'll master real-time analytics faster than a rocket launch.

Whether you're a data explorer, a real-time analytics enthusiast, or just curious about real-time tracking space missions, this session is your ticket to the stars. Prepare for liftoff as we explore how Microsoft Fabric can transform your streaming data into celestial insights.

title: Exploring Real-Time Intelligence with Microsoft Fabric at Avinor
abstract:
Real-time data can transform operations, but where do you start? The day after RTI became generally available at Microsoft Ignite, we jumped right in!

In this session, discover how, together with Microsoft, Avinor, the owner and operator of Norway's airports, is leveraging Fabric's Real-Time Intelligence (RTI) to create actionable insights that can improve operations and the passenger experience. We’ll share our progress, discuss the challenges we've faced and the lessons we've learned, and reflect on the potential to scale these solutions to multiple use cases.

title: Extending Fabric Made Easy - How to Bring New Capabilities to the Community
abstract: Have you ever envisioned building your own extension for Fabric that could provide value to your organization? Or even monetizing and publishing it for the whole Fabric community? With the Fabric Workload Developer Kit you can do exactly that. In the session we will cover how you can build a workload in Fabric and publish it to the world in seconds.

title: Extending Fabric Monitoring for Custom Requirements
abstract:
Microsoft Fabric offers a rich collection of out of the box monitoring functionality. No matter if you are a Fabric administrator, data steward, domain owner, capacity- or solution admin, there is a out of the box solution for your purpose.

However, there may be cases in which you want to enrich the provided reports with your organization specifics. You may want to plot the Fabric adoption across your organizational hierarchy? Or extend the retention of the data beyond 30 days?

In this session, we will show the out of the box solutions Fabric offers, to understand them and where to find them. Also, we will explain various customization purposes. From simple report customizations, to export options, to automated patterns for long term saving of the data without leaving the Fabric ecosystem!

Learning objectives of this session:
