- Where to find the various monitoring reports in Fabric
- Understand these reports inside out
- Customize the visualizations in these reports
- Extract the monitoring data from the admin space for customization and long term saving
- Enriching reports with your organizational specific data

title: Extending Power BI with Microsoft Fabric: Data Ingestion Patterns
abstract:
Power BI has been a life changer for business analysts, offering ETL tools like Power Query with overwrite and incremental refresh for ingesting data. With the introduction of Microsoft Fabric, self-service users now have access to advanced tools like Dataflow Gen2 for appending data and Notebooks for powerful updates like upserts (merge into) and Change Data Feed (CDF) for tracking changes.

This session highlights the evolution from traditional analytic tools, starting with Excel, moving through Power BI, and culminating in Fabric's expanded ecosystem, to empower business users to build more robust data ingestion patterns. We’ll explore how these new tools support scenarios where data sources are primarily self-service processes from other business areas rather than governed data warehouses.

Learn how to evaluate source reliability and design solutions accordingly, starting with landing zones and extending through transformation layers.

Especially if you're working with inconsistent data sources, this session provides practical guidance for creating future-proof architectures for data ingestion that bridge the gap between self-service flexibility and enterprise-grade reliability.

title: External Data Sharing Decision Guide
abstract:
Did you know that there are more than 10 features in Fabric that allow sharing data with users outside of your organization? External data sharing, B2B, database shortcuts, Power BI embeded, SAS tokens, publish to web and more.

Do you know when to use which feature?

This session will review all the Fabric features, including some brand new capabilites, which enable external data sharing. At the end of this session you should have a basic understanding of many ways that Fabric enables you to expose data outside of your tenant and which feature is the best solution for a given business scenario.

title: Fabric Automation and Dev Tools
abstract:
In this session, we embark on a journey to uncover the latest updates in Fabric APIs and development tools. Witness the power of Infrastructure as Code as we showcase the Terraform Provider for Microsoft Fabric. Learn how to harness its capabilities to define, provision, and manage your configuration, ensuring a seamless and scalable deployment.

Experience the enhanced control and operational efficiency with the new Fabric CLI, empowering you to seamlessly manage and orchestrate Fabric configuration.

Delve into the new features and updates around the Fabric REST API, designed to integrate with other systems, automate intricate workflows, and simplify management tasks.

Join us as we explore these tools and features, demonstrating how they work in unison to automate and operate Microsoft Fabric

title: Fabric Data Engineering Roadmap
abstract: Fabric Data Engineering empowers data engineers to build out a lakehouse architecture and transform their data, at scale, using Spark. Join this session to learn more about the latest updates to Data Engineering in Fabric, as well as what's coming in the near future.

title: Fabric Data Factory - Best-In Class Connectivity with Oracle, SAP and More to Deliver Business Impact
abstract:
Deriving insights from SAP data is top of mind for many enterprises.
Learn how the latest innovations in Microsoft Fabric help you to accelerate time to value for your SAP data, whether it's through Data Factory's data integration and mirroring capabilities, dedicated SAP data models, Copilots or AI skills.

title: Fabric Data Factory: What's New and Roadmap
abstract: In this session, you will learn the exciting product innovations and roadmap for Fabric Data Factory You will learn how Fabric Data Factory provides industry-leading data movement, transformation and orchestration capabilities. You will learn how AI-powered development experiences will enable you to be more productive, and effective to build data integration solution.

title: Fabric Mirroring for SQL Server
abstract: The new SQL Server Fabric mirroring and replication continuously replicates data in real-time from on-premises SQL Server, SQL Server on Azure VMs, or non-Microsoft clouds to Fabric OneLake. This enables customers to order to facilitate analytics and insights on the unified Fabric data platform.

title: Fabric Mirroring with PostgreSQL on Azure
abstract: How do you integrate PostgreSQL data with OneLake to unlock the potential of Fabric mirroring? This session will cover how to deliver near real-time analytics, data science, ML & AI experiences and cross database querying while protecting your operational databases from the overhead of analytical queries. Learn how to stream PostgreSQL data from Azure to Fabric with zero ETL and take advantage of Azure database for PostgreSQL's unique AI integration and centralized identity management capabilities.

title: Fabric Real-Time Intelligence for PowerBI Users
abstract: Leverage the power of Fabric RTI to build real-time solutions with Power BI and real-time dashboards. We'll share when to choose each technology, highlight their pros and cons, and provide a reference architecture that compares the journey and challenges of transitioning from a traditional batch-based approach to a near real-time model. Additionally, we'll demonstrate how easily Power BI users can get started with Fabric RTI for seamless integration and real-time insights.

title: Fabric and Azure Databricks: Lessons From the Field
abstract: Microsoft Fabric and Azure Databricks share many core architectural principles, while differing due to the nature of SaaS and PaaS. In this session we will describe lessons learned from using Fabric and Databricks at FSI clients, along with ways to build you lakehouse to effectively use both platforms to enable success, including leveraging Unity Catalog in Fabric and where Mirroring can complement your Lakehouse on OneLake.

title: Fabric for the Power BI Developer and Consumer
abstract: With Microsoft Fabric now available, some Power BI users might have questions about what it means for them. In this session, we will cover all the current and new features and capabilities that are important to you. Fabric has added several new personas, but the Power BI developer and consumer are still essential and we will explore how you fit in, covering topics such as licensing, direct lake, connecting to the various computes engines, developing models, using Copilot, and much more.

title: Fabric git/ALM End to End Journey with Lakehouse, Shortcuts and Variable Library
abstract: Learn all about how to get Lakehouse, Shortcuts into git and controlling CI/CD across multiple stages of production. We will show and share code on how to get a full end to end scenario, using variable libraries to control deployment of your items.

title: From Data to Decisions: Reimagine Data Management and BI With MS Fabric and Agentic AI
abstract: Organizations struggle with fragmented data, poor quality, and inefficiencies that slow down decision-making. This session explores how Sonata’s Lightning Data Suite (LDS)—powered by Microsoft Fabric and Agentic AI—transforms data management and BI through real-time insights, automated analytics, and AI-driven decision-making. Discover how AI agents autonomously analyze complex data, LLM-powered self-service analytics simplify insights, and automation enhances forecasting, anomaly detection, and strategic recommendations. Through real-world examples, learn how AI-driven BI solutions boost efficiency, reduce manual intervention, and accelerate decision velocity—redefining the future of business intelligence.

title: From Idea to Innovation, What's Next in Data Factory Design
abstract: Gain exclusive insights on innovations and improvements coming to the Data Factory experience — and make your mark! As we aim to craft a product you love to use, we want you to be a part of the process. In this interactive session, you’ll see proposals for experience improvements currently in the works, and you’ll be invited to react, provide feedback in real-time, and share your own ideas. This is your opportunity to directly influence the roadmap for Data Factory with the team behind the tools.  Join us to be a part of this exciting journey of co-design, where your input can shape the future of Data Factory.

title: From Setup to CI/CD: Automating Microsoft Fabric for Scalable Data Solutions
abstract:
Unlock the full potential of Microsoft Fabric in this demo-packed session tailored for data professionals and enthusiasts. Discover how to automate the end-to-end lifecycle of a Fabric solution, from setting up a Fabric data platform and designing metadata-driven workflows to implementing enterprise-grade CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps.

Drawing from real-world experience with multiple Fabric data lakehouse implementations, this session will provide actionable insights, tips, and tricks to overcome current limitations and streamline your projects. You'll learn to:

- Leverage Fabric REST APIs for solution automation and maintenance.
- Use Fabric databases as metadata stores for data ingestion, preparation, and modeling.
- Automate deployment of key components like notebooks, data pipelines and semantic models utilizing Fabric REST APIs.
- Integrate Azure DevOps for CI/CD, workspace setup, and feature branch automation.
- Explorer the Terraform provider for Fabric to enable infrastructure-as-code.

Through live demonstrations and practical examples, this session equips developers, data engineers, and architects with tools and techniques to optimize operations and scale solutions across environments. Join us and transform how you build, deploy, and manage Fabric solutions!

title: Generating Data-Driven Insights on Your AI-Powered Applications Using Azure Cosmos DB Mirroring
abstract:
In today’s digital landscape, the rise of AI-driven chat applications has transformed user interactions and elevated customer expectations. As organizations deploy generative AI for better customer experiences, customer support, and more, understanding the full spectrum of user engagement and system performance becomes essential. This session delves into the importance of end-to-end analytics for AI-powered applications storing data in Azure Cosmos DB. Mirroring in Microsoft Fabric offers a turnkey solution, providing comprehensive dashboards and visualizations that can drive measurable business value.

We will show how you can use mirroring to get rich insights on user engagement, conversational quality, performance, and usage trends of AI-powered chat applications. By monitoring AI-specific metrics, teams can continuously refine their generative models, ensuring that responses remain relevant, accurate, and aligned with business goals.

title: Get Started and Collaborate to Build Data Solutions on Fabric with Ease
abstract: New to Fabric and ready to embark on your data solution journey? This session introduces the fundamentals of building and managing end-to-end data solutions with ease. Discover how Fabric’s intuitive task flows and workspace tools enhance collaboration, streamline organization, and optimize workflows. Whether you're taking your first steps or looking to improve teamwork, this session will provide the insights and tools you need to confidently create and manage seamless solutions from start to finish.

title: Getting Started with Open Mirroring in Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
Join us for a session on Open Mirroring, a key component for data management and replication. This session will cover:

**Overview: Introduction to Open Mirror, which provides a landing zone for logs in a predefined format for data replication.
**Requirements: Basic and advanced scenarios for using the Landing Zone protocol.
**Data Handling: Processes for initial data loading and handling incremental changes, including file formats and metadata management.
**Schema Management: Managing schema changes such as adding, deleting, and renaming columns.
**Limitations and Future Enhancements: Current limitations and potential future improvements.

Ideal for data engineers and IT professionals, this session will provide a comprehensive understanding of the Open Mirror Landing Zone and its role in efficient data handling.

title: Harnessing the Power of DAX for Common Analytical Scenarios
abstract: DAX is a cornerstone of Power BI. As the capabilities of DAX continue to evolve, staying updated is crucial for maximizing its potential. In this session, we will explore the latest advancements in DAX and their practical applications for business calculations, enhancing code reusability, and conducting time-based analyses. Additionally, gain an exclusive preview of upcoming features that will redefine how you approach analytical queries. Join us to discover how these innovations can help you harness the full power of DAX and elevate your data analytics expertise.

title: Harnessing the Power of Onelake and AI Foundry
abstract: Join us for an in-depth session on the transformative capabilities of Microsoft Fabric's Onelake and AI Foundry. Discover how Onelake's interoperability allows seamless data integration across various engines and formats, including Delta, Iceberg and support for unstructured data. Explore real-world use cases and see how AI Foundry integrates with Fabric to enhance data science and engineering workloads. This session will provide valuable insights into how these technologies are driving innovation and efficiency in data and AI.

title: How Lufthansa Group Successfully Migrated its Data Catalog from Azure Purview to Microsoft Purview
abstract: In today's data and AI-driven world, the effective management and utilization of data assets are essential for companies and enterprises. This session will showcase Lufthansa Group's successful migration of its well-populated data catalog from classic Azure Purview to the Unified Catalog in Microsoft Purview. The presentation offers insights on the migration strategy, the mapping of business concepts from classic Purview to the new experience, and the challenges faced. Additionally, the session contains guidelines, best practices, and lessons learned that may assist other organizations in a similar transition. The communication strategy employed by Lufthansa Group is also detailed to provide insight into managing stakeholder expectations before, during, and after the transition. This review serves as a valuable resource for companies looking to migrate their data catalog and leverage the benefits of Microsoft Purview.

title: How Much is Fabric | Strategies for Estimating Fabric Capacity Expense
abstract: In today's rapidly evolving digital landscape, accurately estimating fabric capacity expenses is crucial for optimizing resource allocation and managing costs effectively. This session will delve into the various strategies and best practices for estimating fabric capacity expenses within the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem. Attendees will gain insights into the key factors influencing fabric costs, including workload patterns, resource utilization, and scaling considerations. Through real-world examples and expert guidance, participants will learn how to develop robust cost estimation models that align with their organization's budgetary goals and operational requirements. Whether you're a business intelligence developer, IT manager, or financial analyst, this session will equip you with the knowledge and tools needed to make informed decisions about fabric capacity planning and expense management.

title: How e6data Powers 10x Faster Unified SQL and Vector Search for Fabric AI Workloads
abstract:
Join us for an in-depth session on how to run unified SQL and Vector Search on Microsoft Fabric using the e6data lakehouse compute engine.

Today, building vector search capabilities involves triaging data silos, data movement and challenges with complex queries. e6data addresses these challenges with an atomically scalable architecture built for high concurrency, low latency use cases, powering downstream AI workloads such as RAG, recommendation systems and fraud detection systems.

Our engine delivers query results up to 10x faster, scales to 1000+ queries per second and beyond at just one-third the cost. Using features like v-order optimization and direct connectivity to OneLake, Power BI, Delta Tables, and Fabric workspaces, e6data keeps your data secure and in place, removing the need for data movement, query rewrites, and complex migrations.

title: How-to Guide: Deploying OneLake at Scale
abstract: In this session, you’ll learn how to unify your organization’s entire data estate in OneLake and carry out a full range of analytics tasks on a single copy of your data. Whether you have data in Azure, Snowflake, Databricks, or other clouds/environments, OneLake simplifies bringing it all together without any data movement or duplication necessary. We’ll provide a step-by-step approach for deploying OneLake at scale, including adding data using OneLake shortcuts, making it discoverable with the OneLake catalog, and securing access with OneLake security. We’ll also show how OneLake’s openness allows you to choose your favorite tool for the job, whether it’s a Fabric workload, a local Python notebook, or an application in another cloud. Join us to explore these best practices and much more!

title: Integrating Dynamics 365 with Microsoft Fabric
abstract: In this session, we will show how to easily extract and leverage data from Dynamics 365 into Microsoft Fabric without diving into technical complexities like SQL endpoints or Spark compute. This session will guide you through the practical steps of linking Dynamics 365 to Microsoft Fabric, moving data into the Lakehouse, and utilizing the tools within Fabric to gain valuable insights. We will dive into different integration patterns that connect D365 with Fabric, providing architectural insights to help organizations streamline their data pipelines and enhance analytics.

title: Integrating Microsoft Fabric and Azure AI Foundry for a Real-World Scenario
abstract: In today’s AI-driven world, the integration of data and AI platforms is more critical than ever. This session focuses on using Azure AI Foundry and Microsoft Fabric to implement a real-world solution. We will demonstrate how to ingest and process data, train and consume predictive models, and leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) to address a common business challenge. Join us to explore how these technologies work together to deliver impactful, responsible AI solutions for developers and data scientists.

title: Intro to Data Visualization in Fabric Notebooks for the Power BI Pro
abstract: Are you a Power BI report pro who is curious about data visualization in Fabric notebooks? Then this session is for you. We’ll explore notebooks in Fabric and discuss when you might use a notebook instead of a Power BI report. You’ll learn how to get started creating visuals in notebooks using Python. We’ll compare capabilities of common Python libraries with more complex visuals such as Deneb. And we’ll show you how you can combine Power BI reports and Fabric notebooks. Expand your data viz skills by adding notebooks to your repertoire.

title: Intro to PySpark in Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
With all of the engineering features in Microsoft Fabric, which medium should you use to move and transform data? Low-code data flows and pipelines? Good old relational SQL? What about this newfangled PySpark everyone is buzzing about?

If the last option piques your curiosity and you haven't tried it, this is the session for you. I'll cover basic Python principles that will make even complicated Python easy to read. Then I will showcase how to interact with and manage your Spark environment, boosting performance while simplifying interactions with data storage in Microsoft Fabric. Finally, I'll showcase Fabric features and community content that can support your next steps in learning to implement PySpark.

title: Knowledge at Your Fingertips: A Blueprint for Building Data-Driven AI Agents
abstract: Fabric is used as data engineering pipeline to turn raw teams messages into a knowledge base with data science and LLMs. The knowledge base is used for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with function calling for an AI Agent. We discuss how to also create a pipeline to continuously update a benchmark accounting for data drift. The teams messages can be processed at scale using a hierarchical agglomerated clustering to create a knowledge base and a FAQ.

title: Lean on Your Data Tribe: Thriving Amidst Constant Change
abstract:
In an era of relentless technological advancements, the data landscape is evolving at an unprecedented pace. Staying ahead requires more than just individual effort—it demands the collective wisdom, support, and innovation found within a strong community. In this session, we will delve into the transformative power of the Microsoft Fabric community in navigating the complexities of modern data environments. We will explore the crucial role that the community plays in fostering continuous learning, problem-solving, and career growth. We will discuss how engaging with a community can provide invaluable resources, mentorship, and support, enabling individuals to adapt swiftly and effectively to new technologies and methodologies. Through real-world examples, attendees will learn how to leverage their data tribe to not only keep pace with change but to thrive and excel in their professional growth.

Join us to discover how leaning on your data tribe can empower you to overcome challenges, seize opportunities, and achieve sustained success in a rapidly evolving data world.

title: Learning PostgreSQL as a SQL Server User
abstract:
More and more organizations are hosting their data on multiple platforms. One of the fastest growing relational platforms is PostgreSQL. While the root behaviors of tables and relationships between them are the same, there remains a very distinct set of differences between PostgreSQL and other platforms.

If you've been a SQL Server user, developer, DBA, and your organization is now adding PostgreSQL to the mix, you may have a somewhat steep learning curve ahead. This session is meant to reduce the size of that hill you're going to climb as you add PostgreSQL skills. We'll cover the common aspects of both platforms, the subtle differences between the two, and, of course, some of the unique behaviors to separates PostgreSQL from SQL Server. You'll get a good introduction to the core behaviors of PostgreSQL and the appropriate language to use when working with that data platform. All of this is designed to flatten out that learning curve and get you started supporting PostgreSQL just as well as you currently support SQL Server.

title: Lessons Learned While Replacing ADF and Azure SQL
abstract:
This session will explore the journey of migrating a client's data warehouse from an Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL-based setup to a Fabric Data Warehouse with Fabric Pipelines. Attendees will gain insights into the challenges faced, solutions implemented, and best practices discovered during the migration process. The session aims to provide practical advice and actionable strategies for organizations considering a similar transition.

Session Outline
- Introduction (5 minutes)

- Welcome and speaker introduction
- Overview of the session objectives and agenda
- Background and Context (10 minutes)

- Brief overview of the client's original data warehouse setup using Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL
- Reasons for migrating to Fabric Data Warehouse and Fabric Pipelines
- Planning the Migration (10 minutes)

- Initial assessment and requirements gathering
- Key considerations and challenges identified
- Developing a migration strategy and timeline
- Migration Process (15 minutes)

- Detailed steps of the migration process
- Tools and technologies used
- Handling data transformation and integration
- Ensuring data integrity and consistency
- Challenges and Solutions (10 minutes)

- Common challenges encountered during the migration
- Solutions and workarounds implemented
- Lessons learned and best practices
- Post-Migration Activities (5 minutes)

- Validation and testing
- Performance tuning and optimization
- Monitoring and maintenance
- Q&A and Discussion (10 minutes)

- Open floor for questions from the audience - Interactive discussion on specific challenges and experiences - Conclusion (5 minutes)

- Recap of key takeaways
- Final thoughts and recommendations
- Information on additional resources and support

title: Load Testing Storage Performance for SQL Server
abstract:
In this session, we will delve into the fundamentals of load testing for SQL Server. We will cover everything from planning to execution and interpreting the results to enhance performance. Participants will gain valuable insights into creating a load test that accurately mirrors their specific environment, whether it's on-premises or in the cloud.

Key concepts such as understanding hardware capabilities, virtual machine configurations, cloud-specific considerations, and a detailed examination of the I/O stack and queuing mechanisms will be explored. We will then move on to discuss different load-testing strategies, comparing synthetic and real workloads, and reviewing popular tools such as DiskSpd, HammerDB, and Workload Tools. Additionally, we will learn how to utilize SQL Server's own capabilities for simulating workloads.

Collecting performance data is a critical part of the process, and we will demonstrate how to automate this using PowerShell extract performance metrics from SQL Server DMVs and PerfMon.

Finally, we will focus on interpreting the collected data, including a live demo to illustrate how to analyze queuing behavior in order to identify potential bottlenecks.

This session is designed for DBAs, system administrators, and developers who are seeking to improve their load-testing strategies and optimize SQL Server performance.

title: Manage, Govern, and Secure Your Fabric Data with OneLake Catalog and Microsoft Purview
abstract: Securing and governing data across a fragmented data estate is a complex and expensive challenge for both data and security officers. In this session, we'll share how you can govern your Fabric data using the OneLake catalog and tackle data security challenges using the built-in capabilities in Fabric and by accessing the advanced and estate-wide capabilities of Microsoft Purview.

title: Master Your Copilot - How to Optimize Your Power BI Semantic Models for AI
abstract:
Copilot is a game-changer for productivity and insights, but if you’ve tried it with Power BI, you might have noticed it doesn’t always deliver the magic you expected.

What many people don’t realize is that the quality of Copilot’s responses heavily depends on the structure and design of your Power BI Semantic Model. The good news? With just a few tweaks, you can dramatically improve its results and accuracy.

In this session, I’ll show you exactly how to adapt your data model to unlock Copilot’s full potential. From simple tweaks to advanced techniques, you’ll leave equipped to make your Copilot smarter, better and more reliable

title: Mastering Data Modeling for Power BI and Fabric: Best Practices and Techniques
abstract:
Data modelling is a critical aspect of creating efficient and effective Power BI reports. In this session, we will discuss the best practices and techniques for building robust data models that enhance usability, performance, adaptability, and scalability. We will discuss how to interpret business requirements to conceptualise the model, plan development with tables structured in a star schema, and create organization-wide conformed dimensions.
Attendees will learn how to apply these principles to their actual models, ensuring that their Power BI reports are functional and optimised for performance. We will cover the entire process from user requirements to the finished report, providing practical tips on how to turn initial ideas into brilliant, well-performing, adaptable, and scalable reports.
Through real-world examples and case studies, you will gain insights into the common challenges and solutions in data modelling for Power BI. By the end of the session, you will have a clear understanding of how to design and build data models that meet the needs of your organisation and support complex business scenarios.
Join our conversation on elevating your Power BI reports with effective data modelling techniques and best practices.

title: Mastering Data Movement in Microsoft Fabric with Batch, Real-Time Streaming, and Mirroring
abstract: Join us to explore how you can use Microsoft Fabric for unify your data estate with Microsoft Fabric. In this session, you will get up to speed with using a rich set of capabilities in Microsoft Fabric for copying, replicating and virtualizing your data to OneLake. You will learn best practices on working with batch, incremental, real-time data and how you can efficiently and effectively get the data you need to the right place for analytics.

title: Mastering Fabric Data Engineering Admin and Capacity Management
abstract:
Data Engineering workload in Microsoft Fabric empowers data teams to accelerate their analytics initiatives. To maximize its potential, effective administration and capacity management are crucial when operating in production. This session will delve into the various levels of administrative and governance controls available within workspaces, capacities for Fabric Data Engineering, including Notebooks, Lakehouses, and Spark Job Definitions

This session will cover:
Establishing a Robust Governance Framework: Understand administrative roles, permissions, and best practices for managing compute

Optimizing Resource Allocation: Learn how to effectively manage workspaces and capacities to ensure optimal performance and cost efficiency.

Scaling Your Data Platform: Discover best practices for scaling Fabric Data Engineering to meet the growing demands of your organization.

title: Mastering Lakehouse Maintenance: From Basics to Automation with Semantic Link Labs
abstract:
Maintaining your Lakehouse is crucial for ensuring optimal performance and scalability.

In this session, we'll explore the fundamentals of Lakehouse maintenance, why it matters, and how you can streamline these processes. Learn how to leverage the powerful Semantic Link Labs library to automate maintenance tasks with practical examples and actionable insights.

Whether you're a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or a Fabric Administrator, this session will empower you to optimize your Lakehouse operations with ease.

title: Microsoft Fabric - The Command Line Way
abstract:
In today’s fast-paced development environment, CLI tools are essential. Microsoft Fabric CLI unlocks new possibilities for developers, offering enhanced deployment and configuration options.

- Explore Fabric CLI modes—interactive and command line—enabling seamless interaction with Fabric.
- Learn the commands for deploying and managing resources with step-by-step demos.
- Discover how to integrate Fabric CLI with ADO pipelines and - GitHub Actions for automated deployments and robust CI/CD pipelines.

Join us to discover how these features can elevate your Fabric development and get an exclusive look at what’s next for CLI from the Fabric product team.

title: Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Intelligence to Leverage Dynamics 365 Data and Enhance Insights
abstract: In this instructional session, we will delve into the integration of Dynamics 365 data into Microsoft Fabric for real-time intelligence. Attendees will learn how to leverage event sourcing and other patterns for seamless data integration. Additionally, we will explore techniques to surface this real-time data back into Dynamics 365 and Dataverse, ensuring enhanced insights and operational efficiency. Join us to discover practical techniques and best practices for implementing these patterns to ensure a seamless and efficient data flow.

title: Microsoft Purview Data Governance in the Era of AI
abstract: This session will cover governance as a whole, the details of Microsoft Purview's Data Governance experience, and the new Unified catalog

title: Microsoft Purview Data Security in the Era of AI
abstract: This session will cover the Microsoft Purview Data Security protections across structured & unstructured data.

title: Mirror, Mirror on the Wall: Leveraging Fabric's Mirroring Features for Optimal Data Platform Creation
abstract: Join Insight to explore the integration of Azure SQL Database, Azure Databricks, and Snowflake into Fabric OneLake, uncover effective Fabric patterns combining pipelines and mirroring, and learn how to accelerate development with Copilot. Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your data platform capabilities!

title: Modern Self-Service Planning & Writeback in Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
An exciting new era of planning has arrived. Legacy planning tools slow down decision-making by creating data silos and not leveraging your existing data platform investments. Hear from Gopal Krishnamurthy, Founder & CEO of Lumel, about how business users can achieve modern self-service planning directly on top of Microsoft Fabric without creating any more silos. This unified approach empowers creating budgets, forecasts, and scenarios in under 10 minutes, all with enterprise-grade governance. Organizations can now achieve a modern no-code planning system that has integrated Master Data, Reporting, and Analytics with Microsoft Fabric and Power BI.

In this session, you’ll see the disruptive innovation through modular and decoupled architecture that is transforming enterprise planning. See advanced capabilities like driver-based modeling, hybrid multidimensional planning, and deep integration with your reference data with approval, workflow, and governance. Whether you're a finance, data, or BI professional, this session will show you how to break down silos, accelerate planning cycles, and unlock new levels of efficiency—all within a single, unified environment.

title: Navigating the Realities of AI in Microsoft Fabric: Lessons from Avanade's Journey
abstract:
While Microsoft excels at showcasing Fabric as a seamless and user-friendly platform, our experience at Avanade since the Private preview has shown that the reality involves a series of practical steps. Setting up and using AI in Fabric involves understanding the intricacies of the platform and integrating it with existing systems. However, these challenges are not insurmountable. With a clear path forward, including thorough planning, dedicated resources, and a willingness to learn and adapt, organizations can successfully leverage the powerful AI capabilities of Microsoft Fabric.

At Avanade, we've gained valuable lessons from testing Microsoft Fabric. We complement Microsoft's marketing with practical insights, understanding the platform's capabilities, identifying use cases, and developing robust deployment strategies. By sharing our experiences, we aim to help organizations navigate the platform's complexities, unlock its potential, and achieve their business goals.

Our focal point will be using Fabric data warehouses to get data into end users' hands by leveraging AI. Tools like Copilot enable efficient insights without extensive coding. Fabric AI skills offer a customized experience, making data accessible even without complex engineering tools. Report developers can quickly create interactive visuals using Power BI with real-time data. Fabric's unified approach supports data engineers, analysts, and scientists, streamlining operations and enhancing efficiency.

title: Operational RAG Solutions with Azure SQL and Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
Join us for an in-depth exploration of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and its operational applications, powered by Azure SQL and Microsoft Fabric. This session will provide a comprehensive overview of the architecture, best practices, and advanced techniques for implementing and managing RAG solutions within enterprise environments.

Participants will gain insights into the seamless integration of Azure SQL and Fabric robust data management capabilities with Microsoft Fabric's flexible framework, enabling the creation of scalable, efficient, and secure data retrieval and processing systems. The session will cover the fundamental principles of RAG, its diverse industry applications, and emerging trends that will shape its future.

Learn how to optimize performance, enhance data security, and manage complex deployments while pushing the boundaries of data-driven decision-making. By the end of this session, attendees will be equipped with the knowledge and tools to drive innovation and excellence in their data solutions using Azure SQL and Microsoft Fabric.

title: Optimizing Fabric Spark and Best Practices for Production-Ready Workload
abstract:
This session aims to equip you to confidently deploy Fabric Spark for real-world production. Learn best practices, tackle scaling challenges, and unlock peak price-performance.

Walk away with:
Production-ready Fabric Spark orchestration tools and tips
Proven best practices for seamless go-live
Strategies for optimal price-performance
Tips & Tricks for large-scale data engineering

title: Optimizing and Automating Microsoft Fabric and Power BI with Semantic Link/Labs
abstract: Semantic Link and Semantic Link Labs have become essential tools for Power BI developers and admins using Microsoft Fabric to simplify many previously technically-challenging tasks. This session will demonstrate how to leverage Semantic Link and its open-source extension, Semantic Link Labs, and integrate them into your workflows. By the end of this session, attendees will be equipped with practical tools to optimize their semantic models and reports as well as automate tasks previously thought impossible. No prior experience with Python or Semantic Link is required.

title: Patterns for Consistent, Metadata-Driven Processing in Fabric
abstract:
Fabric provides us with a plethora of tools to process and analyse our data, which provides data engineers and other users with a great foundation to build a enterprise-level data solution on.

When delivering a solution that is built to be scalable and maintained over time it is essential that we implement consistent patterns that are repeatable and can be hardened to ensure our delivery is consistent.

In this session we will explore how you can take the base components within Fabric and build a metadata-driven framework on top of them that enables you to deliver consistent patterns for ingestion, data cleansing, data quality and curation.

We'll look at the idea of using data contracts to drive processing and understand how we can take tools such as Data Factory and Spark extend them to utilise metadata to deliver consistent and scalable data pipelines that will enable us to build out data pipelines.

title: Performance Tuning Tips for Fabric Data Factory
abstract: Join us for an in-depth session on Performance Tuning Tips for Fabric Data Factory! Discover strategies to optimize your data workflows, enhance efficiency, and maximize performance. Don’t miss out on expert insights that can revolutionize your data management practices.

Let’s be honest—have you ever looked at a Power BI report and thought, What am I even looking at? Or maybe you feel like you’re just not good at designing reports, so you keep doing it the same way and hoping for better results. You’re not alone, but the good news is: it doesn’t have to be that way.

Creating a great report isn’t just about cramming in ALL the data. It’s about designing something that connects, engages, and makes people say "Whoa, that’s cool—and I actually understand it!" And that’s where this session comes in.

We’ll talk about the magic of UX Design for Power BI and how simple design choices can completely change the way people interact with your data. No jargon, no fluff—just practical tips you can actually use. Together, we’ll cover:
- How humans really process visual information
- Easy design hacks like alignment, color, and simplifying the chaos
- Accessibility tips to make sure everyone can engage with your reports.

This isn’t about turning you into a designer overnight—it’s about giving you the tools to make your data shine. Whether you’re a beginner or a pro, this is your chance to level up!

So, let’s roll up our sleeves and bring your reports to life. As Paul Rand said, “Design is so simple, that’s why it’s so complicated.” Don’t worry—we’ll make it feel simple. See you there!
title: Power BI Meets UX Design: Creating Accessible, Intuitive and Visually Appealing Reports
Power BI Roadmap: Strategy, Vision, and Demos
abstract: Power BI empowers every organization to meet the most demanding modern enterprise needs. As a foundational part of Microsoft Fabric, Power BI is transforming how analytics projects are delivered. See why 97% of the Fortune 500 use Power BI today and understand why customers large and small are standardizing on Power BI. In this session you will hear about the Power BI strategy and glimpse into the future of Power BI with exclusive sneak peeks of upcoming features that empower you to harness the full potential of your data.

title: Professional Integration of Development and Database Administration with SSMS 21
abstract: Integrating development and database administration has historically posed significant challenges, particularly in synchronizing development environments and data structures while maintaining security. With the enhancements in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) 21, including the integration of Git and the assistance of Copilot, there are new avenues for implementing Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) in a more agile and intelligent manner. This session will explore these challenges and the best practices for leveraging these capabilities.

title: Racing to Real-Time Intelligence: Live Insights from Live Data
abstract: The only smoke and mirrors in this session will be tire smoke and rearview mirrors! Are you curious about how to build a Real-Time Intelligence Solution in Fabric but not sure how to generate real-time data for a POC? Join us for this demo-rich session where we will build an RTI solution in an hour, in real-time, using live in-car telemetry data streaming from Forza Motorsport on Xbox. No recorded demos here, just an hour of real demos as we walk you through capturing streaming data in real-time, producing real-time insights on that data with Real-Time Dashboards, and then taking real-time action on that data with Data Activator. You will be able to take what you learn in this session and apply it to the streaming data in your environment (even if your boss won't let you play video games at work).

title: Real Life Learnings from Implementing Microsoft Purview Data Governance
abstract:
In today’s world of data, effective governance is the cornerstone of organizational success. Microsoft Purview Data Governance offers a comprehensive platform to streamline data governance, ensuring compliance, accessibility, and data quality across the data estate. However, implementing Microsoft Purview Data Governance is not without its challenges.

Join us for an engaging session where we’ll take you behind the scenes of deploying Microsoft Purview Data Governance from proof of concepts to enterprise deliveries. We will discuss key learnings from the trenches both successes and pitfalls including necessary preparations, stakeholder alignment, metadata policy and technical essentials for a smooth rollout.

Gain practical tips for overcoming common hurdles such as designing the structure for the data map & unified catalog, what metadata to capture, onboarding data sources such as Microsoft Fabric, Databricks, and non-supported data sources, monitoring of metadata quality and its progress, and driving user adoption.

Whether you're planning to implement Microsoft Purview Data Governance or optimize your existing instance, this talk will equip you with actionable suggestions and steps to ensure your organization leverages the potential of Microsoft Purview Data Governance for value creating data governance.

title: Real-Time Insights and Action from Dynamics 365, Dataverse and Power Platform
abstract: With Fabric Real-time Intelligence, real-time events from IoT and streaming applications can be visualized and acted upon alongside Real-Time Events from Dataverse, the foundation of Dynamics 365 and Power Apps. Critical events streaming from Dynamics 365 can be monitored using Real-Time Dashboards in Fabric. Rules and alerts can be set up to trigger actions quickly within Dataverse or using 1200+ connectors to drive business processes, without requiring advanced developer skills.

title: Revolutionize Your Business with Timely Insights and Actions Using Real-Time Intelligence
abstract: Real Time Intelligence is a transformative technology designed to empower businesses with real-time data insights and analytics. This session will cover the journey of Real Time Intelligence from its inception to its current state, highlighting key features, capabilities, and the impact it has on operational efficiency and decision-making processes. We will also highlight customer success stories and showcase how you can revolutionize your data strategy and unlock new opportunities for growth.

title: Roadmap for Developers in Fabric: Writing a CRUD App Using SQL Database, API for GraphQL and User Data Functions
abstract: Discover how to harness the full potential of Fabric to build powerful modern data-driven applications. In this session participants will learn how to use the API for GraphQL and User Data Functions over SQL databases and other data sources in the Microsoft Fabric Platform to build modern “CRUD” (Create, Read Update and Delete) data APIs that you can immediately call from an application. APIs for GraphQL enable you to effortlessly connect your Fabric data with your applications, with only a few clicks. If you have more complex business logic for your data, you can implement it with Python User Data Functions. With these two powerful building blocks and a SaaS-ified, developer-friendly experience, your app will be up and running in no time!

Come learn about the latest release of SQL Server, SQL Server 2025, with AI built-in, powered by industry proven security, performance, and availability, and connected and integrated to Azure and Microsoft Fabric. SQL Server 2025 provides a unique opportunity to build AI applications on-premises only or connect to the cloud. SQL is the only database to provide consistent AI capabilities ground to cloud to fabric. Come learn about all the new features of SQL Server 2025 including new capabilities specifically designed for the modern database developer.
title: SQL Server 2025: The Enterprise AI-Ready Database Connected with Microsoft Fabric
Sales Forecasting with Microsoft Fabric Notebooks and Fabric Data Science
abstract:
Unlock the power of sales forecasting with Microsoft Fabric Notebooks and Fabric Data Science in this dynamic 60-minute session! Dive into the world of data-driven decision-making and learn how to leverage advanced tools to predict sales trends accurately.

Key Takeaways:
• Hands-On Demonstration: Watch as our expert guides you through the process of creating and using Fabric Notebooks for sales forecasting.
• Data Science Techniques: Discover how to apply cutting-edge data science methods to enhance your forecasting models.
• Practical Insights: Gain valuable tips and best practices for integrating Fabric Data Science into your sales strategy.

This session is designed to equip you with the skills and knowledge to improve your sales forecasting accuracy and drive better business outcomes. Don’t miss this opportunity to elevate your data science capabilities and transform your sales predictions!

title: Securing Fabric Copilot Interactions: Introducing Purview Controls
abstract: Data security and compliance is one of the biggest concerns for ITDMs and SDMs when purchasing or adopting Microsoft AI services. In this session, we're excited to show you Purview controls to help secure and govern Fabric Copilot. Discover data security and compliance risks, such as sensitive data flowing in and out of Fabric Copilot interactions, Protect sensitive data so Fabric Copilot only accesses data based on users' permissions, and Govern AI usage by detecting and investigating non-compliance usage of Fabric Copilot.

title: Securing Your Data in Fabric: Best Practices for Data Warehouse Security in Microsoft Fabric
abstract: In today’s data-driven landscape, securing your Fabric Data warehouse is paramount to safeguarding critical business information and maintaining customer trust. This session explores best practices for implementing robust security within Microsoft Fabric’s Warehouse. This session will offer a deep dive on securing your Data warehouse and practical strategies for protecting your data assets and ensuring end-to-end data integrity. Attendees will gain insights into Fabric's built-in workspace roles, new item permissions and effective ways to easily share your Warehouse, understand the SQL Security model and gain a deep understanding of how to achieve fine-grained access control within Fabric Warehouse using Row level security, Column level security, Dynamic data masking and more. Furthermore, we will also focus on how to ensure robust auditing and compliance by deep-diving into features that we provide within the control plane and data plane auditing in Fabric Warehouse. But that's not all! Stay ahead of the curve as we give you a sneak peek into the exciting innovations on the horizon, ensuring you are well-prepared to leverage the latest advancements in data security and infrastructure. This Fabric Warehouse Security session promises to equip you with a comprehensive understanding of control plane and data plane security, and a glimpse into our future roadmap.

title: Securing Your Data with OneLake in Fabric: Adoption, Security, and Disaster Recovery
abstract:
Join us for an engaging session on OneLake in Microsoft Fabric, where we will delve into:

- Introduction to OneLake in Fabric - Understand what OneLake is and its significance.
- Adopting OneLake - Learn about the adoption process, focusing on mirroring techniques.
- OneLake Catalog - Explore the features and benefits of the OneLake Catalog.
- Security Essentials - Identify key points to secure your data and common breach points.
- Disaster Recovery and Availability Planning - Best practices for planning resilience and recovery in the event of a disaster.
- Industry Use Cases - See real-world examples of how OneLake is utilized across different industries.

Gain insights on how to integrate, secure, and protect your data effectively with OneLake in Fabric. This session is designed to equip you with the knowledge and tools to ensure your data is always secure and available.

title: Securing Your Fabric Workloads - Best Practices from the Fabric Security Team
abstract: Detailed breakdown of the best practices for securing your Fabric workloads. From how to use the existing security features to meet your business needs, to best practices on how to integrate securely with other Microsoft and third-party resources.

title: Securing Your SQL Database in Fabric is as Easy as 1-2-3
abstract:
Fabric provides a unified data platform that dramatically simplifies life for our customers. The ‘on-by-default’ and simple ‘click-to-enable’ security controls make securing your SQL database in Fabric easier than ever. Specifically:

1. Centralized Identity Management using Microsoft Entra is the default option for authenticating to your database.
2. Auditing is turned on at deployment time and automatically configured to record a wide range of change actions to your database.
3. Encryption-at-rest and encryption-in-transit using the latest cryptographic standards are enabled when the database is deployed.

In addition, SQL Database in Fabric offers private connectivity via Azure Private Link, simplified access management via Fabric and SQL native roles, and centralized policy-based governance using Microsoft Purview Information Protection. In this session we will demonstrate how easy it is to provision a SQL database in Fabric that meets security best practices without becoming a security expert.

title: Securing the Data Landscape: Integrating Microsoft Fabric with Advanced Cybersecurity Strategies
abstract:
In an era where data serves as the backbone of organizational growth, ensuring its security is paramount. This session explores how Microsoft Fabric's capabilities can be harnessed to build robust, secure data ecosystems. Drawing on practical insights and use cases, we will delve into strategies to integrate Microsoft Fabric with advanced security tools such as Azure Purview, Microsoft Sentinel, and SIEM systems. Attendees will leave with actionable knowledge on securing data pipelines, implementing data governance, and leveraging AI-driven security analytics within Microsoft Fabric.

1. Understanding Microsoft Fabric’s Security Features:
- Examine the data security functionalities inherent in Microsoft Fabric.
- Align Fabric’s tools with contemporary cybersecurity requirements.

2. Integrating Microsoft Fabric with Azure Sentinel and SIEM Systems:
- Provide a step-by-step guide to connecting Microsoft Fabric with Azure Sentinel.
- Discuss practical applications of SIEM for effective monitoring and threat detection.

3. Enhancing Security with AI-Driven Threat Detection and Data Governance:
- Utilize Microsoft Purview for comprehensive data governance within Fabric.
- Implement machine learning models to bolster security measures.

4. Adopting Best Practices in Cybersecurity for Data Ecosystems:
- Present real-world examples of securing cloud-native applications.
- Address common challenges encountered in Fabric-based systems.

Target Audience:
- Data Engineers: Designing secure data pipelines.
- Data Stewards: Implementing data governance strategies.
- Cybersecurity Professionals: Enhancing threat detection and mitigation.
- IT Professionals: Managing secure IT infrastructures.

title: Semantic Model Optimization 101, and Why it Matters
abstract:
As our worlds begin their transition from Power BI tenants to Fabric tenants, the humble capacity is now taking on a much larger and broader role, meaning that optimization is more important than ever. When capacities start to reach their limits we are left with 3 options: Scale up (costs money), scale out (costs money), or optimize! Since optimization is free other than the value of our time, why not start optimization with our favorite artifact already on our capacities: The semantic model?

In this session, we will skip past the basics of star schema and dive into why optimization is for everybody, not just the large-format models out there, as well as a practical application of how to leverage a combination of Microsoft-official and free third-party tools to ensure your semantic layer is lean and performant, leaving more capacity units for the other Fabric workloads. Expect to hear about creative approaches to star schema modeling, automated analysis of the model, and how to pick up where the automated tools leave off for further optimization.

title: Semantic Modeling with Power BI and Microsoft Fabric
abstract: Join the Product Group for an in-depth session on new and upcoming capabilities of semantic data modeling within Power BI and Microsoft Fabric. Learn how to enhance your data modeling workflows and achieve greater efficiency in your data analysis and reporting tasks with Power BI. This demo-packed session will show you how by using Power BI Desktop with live edit, DAX query view, and TMDL view and using the Power BI or Fabric workspace with web modeling, writing DAX queries, and Fabric notebooks. Whether you are using the revolutionary new Direct Lake or the popular import storage mode, you don’t want to miss this opportunity to elevate your data modeling and reporting in Power BI to the next level with the latest features and the vision of what is coming next.

title: Simplify Your Dynamics 365 Insights and Action Architecture (and Save Money)
abstract:
Are you using Dynamics 365 or the Power platform, or are you looking to adopt Power platform?

Join two industry veterans from Dynamics 365 FastTrack and Fabric Customer Advisory teams who have worked with many leading organizations in their insights transformation. Learn how to simplify your existing architectures leveraging Fabric Link, Fabric Data warehouse and the Power platform and a host of innovations from Fabric and Power platform teams.

Learn how you can leverage AI agents as well as a host of tools to simplify the transition. Also learn about best practices adopted by leading organizations who have been thru transformations.

title: Spark Acceleration with the Native Execution Engine and Autotune in Fabric
abstract:
Learn directly from the Microsoft Fabric Engineering Product Group about two powerful features that enhance Spark performance in your Lakehouse: the Native Execution Engine and Autotune.

The Native Execution Engine improves the speed of Spark jobs using efficient technologies like columnar data formats and vectorized processing, making it faster to process and analyze large datasets. Autotune simplifies Spark configuration by automatically adjusting settings based on your workload, saving time and effort while improving performance.

This session will provide a practical, in-depth look at how these tools work and how they can help you handle demanding data engineering and machine learning tasks. Whether you’re building pipelines, optimizing ETL jobs, or running advanced analytics, you’ll gain actionable insights from the team that developed these features.

title: Spatial Data Science and Engineering in Microsoft Fabric
abstract: Location plays a critical role in business analytics for optimizing efficiency, maximizing performance, and identifying opportunities over competition. To tackle these location-based challenges, spatial analytics are now enabled with ArcGIS GeoAnalytics for Microsoft Fabric. GeoAnalytics for Fabric is integrated directly into the Fabric Spark runtime and brings a comprehensive set of spatial functions and tools for use across your data science and engineering workflows. These built in capabilities can play an integral role in your medallion architecture as you enable, structure, and refine spatial data to improve data quality and usability, as well as support users across your Fabric environment. In this presentation we provide an overview of the capabilities of GeoAnalytics for Fabric and demonstrate how it can be leveraged to support data engineering, enrichment, analysis, and insight generation in Fabric.

title: Streamlining DataOps in Fabric: Implementing Azure DevOps CI/CD Pipelines for Fabric SQL DB
abstract: Ensuring efficient, consistent, and reliable deployment processes is crucial for maintaining robust, enterprise-ready data solutions. In this session, I will share insights on creating Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines using Azure DevOps for the Fabric SQL DB. Attendees will learn how to leverage Azure DevOps to streamline their development workflows, enhance collaboration, and ensure high-quality data delivery. By the end of this presentation, participants will have a comprehensive understanding of how to implement and optimize CI/CD pipelines to support their organization's data infrastructure needs.

title: Supercharge SQL Development with VS Code
abstract:
This session highlights the enhanced MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code, featuring tools like a revamped Connection Dialog, advanced Object Explorer filtering, a visual Table Designer, an improved Query Results Pane, and an interactive Query Plan Visualizer—all designed to simplify and enhance the SQL development experience.

Discover how these capabilities integrate seamlessly with SQL database in Fabric, empowering developers to build, test, and deploy high-performance applications effortlessly. Learn practical techniques to streamline your workflows and unlock the full potential of SQL development, whether you’re working locally or deploying to the cloud.

Whether you’re working locally or deploying to the cloud, this session showcases the latest innovations and practical techniques that modernize your SQL workflow!

title: Supercharging Data Warehouse Solutions with AI & Functions
abstract: Deriving and extracting insights from data inside Warehouse can be a challenging or code-intensive journey, but it doesn't have to be! Fear not, AI & extensibility experiences in Microsoft Fabric Warehouse bring new ways to transform and analyze data, generate insights, and create visualizations and reports. In this session, we'll learn how to take advantage of the latest and greatest extensibility and AI capabilities across Microsoft Fabric to power your business-critical analytical scenarios from end-to-end.

title: Take Your Power BI Solutions to the Next Level with Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
The world of data and analytics will never be the same since Microsoft Fabric was publicly announced in 2023. This unified platform served in the Software-as-a-Service model and offering end-to-end analytics capabilities opens up a whole spectrum of completely new ways of working for all personas involved in data analytics, including Power BI developers and users.

A great example of a new feature in Fabric that can significantly support Power BI developers and administrators in their work is Semantic Link which connects Power BI workload with elements of data engineering or even data science present in Fabric. But this is just one of many Fabric features that can improve productivity of Power BI users and enable them to move from insights to actions quicker than ever before.

In our session we will cover how different personas from the Power BI world can benefit from switching to Fabric. Come to this session to find out how you can leverage the power of AI-powered, AI-ready and AI-enabled Microsoft Fabric to move your Power BI analytics to the next level and beyond.

After this session you will:
- Have a general understanding of Fabric as a platform and how Power BI fits in.
- Know how you can grow a Power BI solution to a Fabric solution.
- Know how you can leverage Copilot and other AI capabilities to help you build and enrich Fabric solutions.
- Understand what Semantic Link is and how it will enrich your Power BI solutions.

title: Take the Right Action at the Right Time with Real-Time Dashboards and Activator
abstract: Data is only useful when people use it for action, improving their business processes and operations. Activator helps analysts build models that represent their business objects, and define rules for taking action as their business objects change state over time. In this session you'll learn how to get started taking actions on Power BI, and Real-Time Intelligence data. We'll also talk about the direction the product's heading in the future, and how you can help shape it.

title: Taking Large-Scale Data Engineering Projects to Production
abstract: In this session, we’ll dive into the advanced techniques made possible in Fabric to take a large-scale spark data engineering project from development to production. We’ll cover best practices for getting the most value from your implementation, including code parametrization, metadata orchestration, monitoring, data exploration, and deployment. By the end of the session, you’ll have the knowledge and skills needed to leverage the full capabilities of Fabric Data Engineering for a realistic production implementation.

title: Terraform + Microsoft Fabric = OneLove
abstract:
At last year’s European Fabric Community Conference (FabCon) in Stockholm, Microsoft announced the public preview of the Terraform provider for Microsoft Fabric. This milestone has significantly narrowed the gap in automated management of Fabric resources. Terraform, HashiCorp’s industry-leading Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tool, now enables streamlined provisioning and management of Microsoft Fabric environments using code.

In this session, we’ll explore:
* Why Infrastructure-as-Code matters: Discover the value of coding your infrastructure for scalability, repeatability, and efficiency
* What’s possible with the Microsoft Fabric Terraform provider (& friends): Learn how to manage capacities, workspaces, connections, gateways, lakehouses, data pipelines, and other Fabric resources programmatically
* Current limitations and workarounds: Get a clear view of what’s supported, what isn’t, and how to address gaps
* Internal Git integration vs. IaC: What is the role of Microsoft Fabric’s built-in Git integration, where it complements and where it differs from the broader IaC approach

Whether you’re new to IaC or looking to optimize your automation with Microsoft Fabric, this talk will provide actionable insights to elevate your automation strategy.

title: The Data Fabric Blueprint: Creating a Governed, Consumable Data Ecosystem with Microsoft and Profisee
abstract:
Organizations are generating and leveraging more data than ever, but without a strong foundation, it becomes difficult to unify, govern, and deliver trusted, consumable data across the enterprise. This session explores how Profisee Master Data Management (MDM), Microsoft Fabric, and Microsoft Purview work together to ensure high-quality, governed, and business-ready data is seamlessly integrated and available for AI, analytics, and operations.

Attendees will learn how Profisee MDM operates as a native workload within Microsoft Fabric to deliver a single, accurate view of critical business data, providing consistency across analytics and operational systems. Additionally, we’ll highlight how Microsoft Purview works with Profisee MDM to enforce end-to-end governance, lineage, and compliance, making data easily discoverable, well-documented, and ready for business use.

Through real-world use cases, a live demonstration and discussion with experts from the Profisee, Purview and Fabric teams, this session will provide data leaders, architects, and business users with a practical blueprint for delivering business-ready, AI-powered insights through an integrated data fabric. Join us to see how Profisee, Fabric, and Purview can transform your data into a trusted, strategic asset!

title: The Future Unfolded: Microsoft Fabric for AI and Data Science
abstract: This session is an opportunity to understand the forward momentum of Microsoft Fabric's AI and ML investments. Join us to stay ahead of the curve and learn about the most recent updates, upcoming features, and the strategic roadmap for AI powered data analytics.

title: The Future of Fabric Data Warehouse: What's New, What's Coming
abstract: Data warehouse in Microsoft Fabric empowers SQL data engineers to analyze data and accelerate insights at any scale. Join us to learn about the latest developments in Fabric Data Warehouse.

title: The Future of Observability and Highly-granular Data: Exploring Fabric Eventhouse
abstract:
Join us at FabCon LasVegas for an in-depth session on mastering real-time intelligence with Eventhouse. This session will cover advanced strategies, showcase new features, and share best practices to help you get the most out of Eventhouse.

We'll dive into compelling customer stories that highlight successful implementations and innovative uses of Eventhouse. Learn how to master cost management with Eventhouse, ensuring you get the best value while maintaining high performance. We'll also explore techniques for managing and controlling your Eventhouse environment effectively.

To top it off, we'll share valuable tips and tricks that can help you optimize your use of Eventhouse, making your operations smoother and more efficient. Whether you're a seasoned user or new to Eventhouse, this session will provide you with the insights and tools you need to excel.

title: The Journey to Fabric: Tyler Technologies Journey to an Enterprise Data Platform with Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
Discover how Tyler Technologies is transforming to a modern data platform through Microsoft Fabric. This session will highlight Tyler Technology’s ongoing journey to enable their business through data and will showcase real-world examples, lessons learned and best practices to help guide your own organization’s journey to creating a centralized, unified platform.

We will highlight how Tyler utilizes the capabilities within Fabric to support data governance, streamline data transformations, and enable data science, machine learning and deep data analysis. We will also discuss Tyler’s approaches and techniques to ensure their platforms and data is “AI Ready” both in the short and long term.

Throughout this session, we will also cover how Tyler leverages capabilities within Fabric to share data efficiently without duplication, drive collaboration and scalability and to streamline deployments from development to production environments.
We invite you to join us for this insightful session and explore how you can leverage the power of Microsoft Fabric to revolutionize your organization’s data strategy. Don’t miss this opportunity to gain valuable insights and practical knowledge from Tyler Technologies’ transformative journey. We look forward to your participation and to helping you unlock the full potential of your data assets.

title: The Power of Semantic Layers: Ensuring Reliable and Governed BI
abstract:
Developers often create excellent reports, only to be asked for data exports to Excel.

Ultimately, users want only one thing: easy access to data that helps them do their job. While Power BI reports and dashboards are powerful, they can't answer every question. Users may need to create their own reports, build Excel pivots, or extract data for other processes. These needs must be met securely and consistently, avoiding governance bypass, duplicated calculations, or compromised security.

Enter the Semantic Layer.
The semantic layer connects Power BI and Microsoft Fabric back-end systems to end users, offering secure, governed, and user-friendly data access. Certified semantic models means that the content meets the organisation's quality standards and can be regarded as reliable, authoritative, and ready for use across the organisation.

This session will cover:

1. What is a Semantic Model?
Define the semantic layer, its components, and its role in self-service BI.

2. The Certification Process
Explore the structured, repeatable steps required to certify semantic models. This introduces the certification process map and checklist - a list of best practices a model requires to pass to be certified.

3. Deep dive into the Certification Checklist
Learn some common best practices, optimization tips, security considerations, and practical advice for building robust semantic models.

Who Should Attend?

This session is for Data Analysts, Data Engineers, and BI Developers aiming to upgrade models to meet enterprise business and self service needs.

Led by Steve Campbell, a Microsoft MVP and co-owner of a Microsoft data consultancy. Steve previously led data analytics for large-scale EMEA platform implementations.

Key Takeaways
- Understand the Role of Semantic Models.
- Learn the Certification Process and a repeatable framework for ensuring your models meet organisational standards.
- Take away practical tips for optimisation, security, and best practices.

title: The Roadmap for SQL Database in Fabric
abstract: Microsoft Fabric now has an operational database solution, and it is based on SQL Server and Azure SQL! SQL database in Microsoft Fabric is a unique simple, autonomous, and integrated approach for operational databases in Fabric including a platform for new AI applications. Come learn the fundamentals of what, how, and why SQL database in Microsoft Fabric is now part of the amazing story of Microsoft SQL, ground to cloud to fabric. In this session, you will see demos of current capabilities and a look at the roadmap ahead.

title: The Star Schema Playbook: Scaling Beyond Power Query Using Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
Elevate your Power BI expertise by learning how to build scalable, enterprise-grade analytics within Microsoft Fabric. We’ll start by sharing real-world insights from our experience implementing Fabric lakehouse and warehouse solutions, covering key concepts such as environments, workspaces, lakehouses, and warehouses. Next, we’ll demonstrate how to transition from traditional Power Query workflows to advanced data engineering techniques that enhance automation, lineage, modularity, efficiency, and data quality.

We’ll also show how to include industry best practices, like medallion architecture and metadata-driven pipeline orchestration. Finally, we’ll show how to build dimensional models that enable star schemas in your semantic models for seamless Power BI integration. By the end of the session, you’ll have the tools and knowledge you need to design and implement Fabric data solutions that support future-ready analytics.

title: Tips and Tricks for Microsoft Fabric Data Warehouse
abstract:
Microsoft Fabric offers a SQL-based data warehousing experience to complement its lakehouse capabilities. While in time this may provide a simple lift-and-shift option for our on-premises or Azure SQL Database data warehouses, the reality is we're not quite there yet.

In this session we'll discuss some tips and tricks for getting the most out of your Fabric Data Warehouse. We'll cover the issues preventing that straight lift-and-shift, and talk about ways to mitigate or sidestep them. We'll also look at some best practices for design patterns and high performance in your warehouse.

This session is designed for developers, engineers, and their managers to quickly get up to speed with this brand new technology.

title: Track Historical Changes using SCD2 in Dataflows Gen2
abstract:
Have you ever struggled to track changes in your data while keeping a clear history intact? Slowly Changing Dimensions Type 2 (SCD2) offers a powerful way to manage evolving data while preserving its full historical context. With Dataflows Gen2 in Microsoft Fabric, implementing SCD2 has never been easier or more effective.

SCD2 allows you to maintain a complete record of changes, enabling accurate reporting, trend analysis, and informed decision-making. By keeping track of historical data, you can compare past and present states, ensure compliance with data governance requirements, and unlock deeper insights from your datasets.

This session isn’t just about theory—it’s hands-on. You’ll learn step-by-step how to set up SCD2 in Dataflows Gen2 with a live demo and practical guidance. By the end, you’ll have the skills to confidently track changes and manage dynamic data, creating a foundation for reliable analytics and future-proof solutions.

Ready to enhance how you manage your data? Join us and discover how SCD2 can help you bring historical tracking to the next level!

title: Trailblazers: Women Leading the Future of Data and AI
abstract:
Data and AI are reshaping industries, and women leaders are at the forefront of this transformation. In "Trailblazers: Women Leading the Future of Data and AI," hear from an inspiring panel of innovators who are driving change, breaking barriers, and shaping the future of technology.

This session will explore their journeys, the challenges they’ve overcome, and their insights into the evolving data and AI landscape. From technical innovation to impactful leadership, these trailblazers are redefining what’s possible in the industry.

Attendees will leave with actionable insights, inspiration, and a renewed sense of how diversity fuels innovation and accelerates progress in data and AI.

title: Transform Your Business with Integrated Solutions Using SQL Database in Microsoft Fabric
abstract: The promise of SQL Database in Fabric is that it is simple, autonomous, and optimized for AI - but what does that mean for you and your organization? In this session we will explore how various personas can benefit from a deeply integrated operational database in Fabric. Discover how customers are using SQL Database in Microsoft Fabric today, and how Fabric databases can help you build innovative solutions in the age of AI, faster and easier than ever.

title: Transforming Data Management with Virtual AI Agents and Copilots
abstract: Discover how CluedIn, combined with Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Fabric, and Azure AI Studio, is helping organizations meet the growing demand for secure, governed, high-quality data. See first-hand how proactive copilots and AI agents are making data governance and master data management smarter, easier, and more accessible to the business. We’ll show you how to deliver ready-for-anything data, faster than ever.

title: Transforming Data Warehouse Migrations with an AI Powered Assistant
abstract: Join us to explore the migration assistant for Fabric Data warehouse, an AI powered tool designed to revolutionize data warehouse migrations. This session will provide an in-depth exploration of the current capabilities, upcoming features, and the innovative processes that drive our solution. Learn about the challenges we faced, the breakthroughs we achieved, and the future vision we are working towards. Whether you are a SQL Developer or Data Engineer, this presentation will offer valuable insights into the next generation of data migration technology.

title: Transforming Data Without the Tech Debt
abstract:
Despite the rise of modern data stack tooling and robust data infrastructures, data teams are still by the data transformation process and managing changing data requirements from business data users. So why is the ELT process still so painful?

Hear from Josh Hall, Sr. Product Marketing Data Engineer at Coalesce as he explains why having the right technology in place is critical for transforming data and creating data projects at scale. Join this session to learn how Coalesce helps data teams create a single pane of glass for all Microsoft Fabric data projects, and eliminates tech debt typically created as a byproduct of traditional ELT tools.

This session includes a technical overview of gamechanging data transformation, data lineage, documentation, and impact analysis capabilities that help data teams work 10x more productively on any project they touch.

title: Transforming Data into Gold: A Live Demonstration of Microsoft Fabric Lakehouse
abstract:
Dive into the dynamic world of data management with this talk, where we'll unveil a live, end-to-end demonstration of a Metadata-Driven Microsoft Fabric Lakehouse. This session is designed for data professionals eager to explore innovative solutions in data architecture.

Experience first-hand how to transform raw data into valuable insights within a span of 60 minutes, utilizing a robust Lakehouse architecture on Microsoft Fabric.
