Our open-source framework is tailored to boost productivity and elevate development quality in crafting and managing Data Lakehouse solutions.

Key Highlights:
- Discover how to automate data cleaning, validation, and deduplication using PySpark's robust capabilities.
- Learn to articulate business logic for facts and dimensions effectively through SparkSQL.

Attendees will get the code and leave with practical knowledge and insights into implementing a Lakehouse, making data operations more efficient, and harnessing the full potential of Microsoft Fabric.

title: Transforming Data into Insights with Power BI Copilot
abstract: AI is poised to revolutionize how work is done and Power BI is constantly evolving to meet the needs and expectations of its users. In this session, you’ll learn how Microsoft Fabric Copilot for Power BI helps creators be more productive and consumers get insights faster. Hear from the Power BI Product team about how to get the most value from the latest features and innovations in Copilot. The team will also share perspectives into the future roadmap with a sneak peak or two that is sure to excite.

title: Trusted Data, Trusted AI: A Mainframe-to-Cloud Approach for AI-Ready Data
abstract:
Generative AI thrives on the quality and context of its training data, yet a recent study by Precisely and Drexel University highlights that only 12% of organizations report sufficient data readiness for AI initiatives. This alarming statistic underscores a crucial gap: without high-integrity data from across your business, AI models can produce biased, inaccurate, and contextually irrelevant results.

In this session we will explore the pivotal role of trusted data in driving effective AI, with a specific focus on harnessing mainframe-to-cloud data integration for AI readiness. We’ll discuss how you can:
* Establish best practices for transitioning mainframe data to cloud to lay the foundation for reliable generative AI models on Azure.
* Build AI models with complete, unbiased, and fit-for-purpose data, ensuring accurate predictions and actionable insights.
* Enrich AI datasets with trusted third-party data and spatial insights, critical for contextual relevance.
Join us to gain practical strategies for overcoming legacy data integration challenges, enhancing integrity, and unlocking the full potential of AI for transformative business outcomes.

title: Turbocharge Your Queries: Practical Troubleshooting for Data Warehouse Performance
abstract:
Microsoft Fabric’s Data Warehouse is designed to deliver exceptional performance out of the box, but even the best systems can encounter occasional query slowdowns. This session takes you beyond identifying the issue to uncover the “what’s next” in query performance optimization.

We’ll dive into the essentials of query optimization, focusing on actionable steps to understand and improve execution. Learn how to analyze query plans, leverage statistics effectively, apply query hints, and implement best practices in query coding.

Whether you’re new to troubleshooting or a seasoned pro looking for fresh insights, this session will equip you with the tools and strategies to transform performance challenges into optimized solutions. Join us to elevate your troubleshooting game and unlock the full potential of Microsoft Fabric Data Warehouse.

title: Turning Data Factory Anti-Patterns into Better Practices
abstract:
Building data pipelines is easy, right? A few clicks here, some dragging and connecting there, a bit of testing to make sure everything works, and your solution is ready for production!

Or is it…?

Getting a data pipeline to run in production is one thing. Designing it well is a whole different challenge. What seems like a simple solution on the surface can turn out to be a nasty anti-pattern once you consider things like performance and cost.

In this session, we will go through some common anti-patterns in Data Factory solutions, show how to rework them into better practices, and explain why you should even care about more than just making things work.

You will learn how to interpret the Microsoft Fabric Capacity Metrics App, understand how the Data Factory pricing model actually works, and see how small design tweaks can make a big difference.

Join us to hear about our expensive mistakes and painful lessons learned, so you can return to work ready to build ingestion solutions, orchestration pipelines or metadata-driven frameworks that will keep your wallet, coworkers and users happy!

title: Ultimate Productivity for Semantic Models in Fabric Workspaces
abstract:
Unlock the full potential of your semantic model development with the powerful new Git integration in Microsoft Fabric workspaces. In this session, we’ll demonstrate how the PBIP folder structure and TMDL metadata format streamline collaboration and version control. You’ll see how external tools like Tabular Editor fit seamlessly into this workflow to boost productivity and enhance development practices.

We’ll cover best practices for managing deployments across environments, parallel development strategies, and tips for avoiding common pitfalls. Whether you’re managing large-scale projects or iterative model updates, this session provides practical guidance to elevate your semantic modeling in Fabric workspaces.

Join this session to learn actionable techniques that will make your development process faster, smarter, and more efficient!

title: Unified DevOps for Microsoft Fabric, Azure SQL, and SQL Server with Next-Gen SQL Projects
abstract: With Microsoft.Build.Sql SDK-style SQL projects, your database objects are stored as code for seamless development in Microsoft Fabric and client tools like VS Code and Visual Studio, but the advantages don’t stop there. The modernized SQL projects format backs Fabric’s git integration and deployment pipelines for Data Warehouse and SQL database, providing interoperability with extended CI/CD capabilities and your existing DevOps investments for SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, and Synapse Data Warehouse. SQL project’s code analysis and other build-time tests validate database code quality and correctness during continuous integration of code changes. With SQL projects delivering database object updates is easier and more reliable whether you're managing one database or a fleet of databases because the deployment plan is dynamically calculated through the SqlPackage CLI. In this session we’ll learn how to leverage the Fabric experiences for database DevOps in addition to the depth of capabilities from SQL projects such that we can efficiently develop and deploy database changes with source control integration, all with the tools you love.

title: Unify Your Data Estate with OneLake, the OneDrive for Data
abstract: OneLake eliminates pervasive and chaotic data silos created by developers configuring their own isolated storage. OneLake provides a single, unified storage system for all developers. Unifying data across an organization and clouds becomes trivial. With the OneLake Catalog, users can easily explore and discover data to reuse, manage or gain insights. With business domains, different business units can work independently in a data mesh pattern, without the overhead of maintaining separate lakes.

title: Unify Your Data Estate: Interoperability Between Microsoft Fabric and Azure Databricks Through OneLake
abstract:
OneLake unifies your organization’s entire data estate and enables customers to choose to manage their data through multiple data platforms without creating data silos. See how Azure Databricks and Microsoft Fabric can interoperate through OneLake without any data movement or duplication. Access you Databricks data directly from OneLake by any Fabric engine including Power BI in the new blazing fast direct lake mode for the best performance, lowest latency of refresh and optimal compute costs.
Join this session to learn the best practices of leveraging Microsoft Fabric and Databricks together.

title: Unifying Data & AI: Enterprise RAG Architecture with Fabric & Azure AI Search
abstract:
Discover how to architect production-grade Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) solutions by combining Azure AI Search's vector capabilities with Microsoft Fabric's unified data platform. This session explores proven patterns and best practices for building enterprise-scale AI applications that deliver real business impact.
We'll dive into:

Architectural patterns for RAG using Fabric OneLake and Azure AI Search
Vector search strategies for optimal retrieval performance
Integration approaches with Azure AI Studio and popular frameworks
Real-world examples of successful enterprise implementations
Key considerations for security, scale, and governance

Learn how leading organizations are leveraging these technologies to transform their data into intelligent, contextually-aware AI solutions. Whether you're planning your first RAG implementation or scaling existing solutions, you'll gain valuable insights into building robust, production-ready systems.

title: Unifying the Tools of Microsoft Fabric to Launch Robust Data Products
abstract:
Much like assembling the Infinity Stones, combining Microsoft Fabric's vast capabilities into a cohesive and powerful data solution requires precision, strategy, and the right tools. For IT professionals, Data Stewards, and Developers, the challenge lies in mastering discovery, design, build, and launch to create data products that are impactful but also credible, accurate, and robust.

In this Marvel-inspired session, we’ll draw parallels to Thanos’s quest for ultimate power—only this time, the goal is to wield the full potential of Microsoft Fabric to overcome data challenges. Participants will learn how to bring together:

1. Discovery: Navigate your data landscape, establish governance and security, and identify critical gaps to define the metrics that truly matter.

2. Design: Architect data solutions with precision—building scalable models and wireframes that drive actionable insights.

3. Build: Seamlessly connect to diverse data sources, transform raw data into valuable assets, and create high-performing data products.

4. Launch & Iterate: Execute rigorous testing and performance optimizations to ensure your solutions can withstand time and evolving needs.

Through lessons from real-world projects, you’ll gain actionable insights and leave equipped with a playbook—your step-by-step guide to mastering Microsoft Fabric tools, from Synapse and OneLake to Power BI and Purview. This playbook will grant you unparalleled control of your data universe.

Will you harness the full power of Microsoft Fabric or let your data destiny scatter into chaos? The choice is yours—join us to become the hero your data universe needs.

title: Unleash the Power of Mirroring SQL Databases in Fabric - From AI to BI
abstract:
In the era of gen-AI, advanced analytics and rapid digital transformation, it is key to get operational insights of your business and data is foundational to drive businesses and decision-making. Mirroring SQL data in Fabric, was announced GA at Ignite in 2024, enables near-teal time operational data seamlessly without complex ETL, zero data replication costs from source to OneLake and, with zero code.

In this session, you will learn new capabilities of Mirroring Azure SQL databases, SQL Databases in Fabric and Azure SQL Managed Instance and how to further unleash the power of Mirrored data from SQL sources by unlocking the needed BI, AI and data science scenarios with Microsoft Fabric leveraging Lake House, Data Warehouse, AI Skills, Data Engineering and Power BI experiences to accelerate your journey from data to knowledge to insights.

We will show in-depth demonstrations and uncover strategies to enhance operational efficiency, reduce latency, and foster new experiences within Microsoft Fabric. Join us to discover how to leverage the full potential of your data, enabling smarter decisions and unlocking new frontiers from AI to BI.

title: Unlocking Business Value with Agile Workflows in Microsoft Fabric
abstract:
In today’s fast-paced business environment, the success of data analytics projects hinges on delivering actionable insights quickly and at scale. Microsoft Fabric offers powerful capabilities to unify data engineering and analytics, but without clear collaboration workflows, teams risk delays, inefficiencies, and missed opportunities to drive business value. The lack of robust practices for versioning, quality control, and change management can significantly hinder a team’s ability to iterate rapidly and deliver impactful solutions.

This session focuses on enabling teams to maximize the business value of their data projects by adopting proven collaboration workflows tailored to Microsoft Fabric. We will explore practical strategies for integrating source control, CI/CD pipelines, quality control, change tracking, and versioning, all designed to enhance team productivity and accelerate delivery cycles.

To ground these concepts in real-world application, we’ll showcase a common medallion architecture example. This demonstration will guide you through all practical concerns for a data team, from workspace and source control setup to defining team roles and responsibilities. Learn how to handle daily tasks like making and committing changes, creating and reviewing pull requests, and running CI/CD pipelines. You’ll leave with actionable, step-by-step guidance rather than abstract theory.

Whether your organization is scaling analytics capabilities or seeking faster iteration cycles, this session provides the roadmap to align your team’s workflows with your business goals. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn how to turn Microsoft Fabric into a catalyst for delivering value at pace and scale.

title: Unlocking Data-Driven Insights with AI Skills in Microsoft Fabric and Beyond
abstract: Join this session to learn how to create specialized AI skills, known as Data Experts, to harness the power of generative AI in Microsoft Fabric. You’ll see how to tailor these AI Skills to your data and seamlessly integrate them across the Microsoft ecosystem. This session will equip you with practical knowledge to build, deploy, and use Fabric AI skills, transforming your data into a valuable, insight-driven asset across your organization.

As we delve into the realms of Fabric and OneLake, it's crucial to understand the foundational technology that makes OneLake possible: Delta Lake.

Despite the buzz around Fabric and Databricks, many overlook the essential concepts of Delta Lake. This presentation aims to bridge that gap by providing a comprehensive beginner's guide to Delta Lake.

Join us as we explore:

The evolution of data management and the role of Delta Lake
Key concepts and features of Delta Lake
How Delta Lake integrates with modern data platforms like Fabric
Practical use cases and benefits of implementing Delta Lake
By the end of this session, you'll have a solid understanding of Delta Lake and its pivotal role in today's data-driven world.

Let's demystify Delta Lake together and unlock the potential of your data!
title: Unlocking Delta Lake - A Beginner’s Primer
Unlocking Performance: Mastering Query Store for SQL Databases in Azure and Fabric
abstract:
As a performance tuning consultant, I rely on Query Store to quickly identify and fix performance issues without needing in-depth knowledge of my clients’ code or applications. But what's in it for you? Query Store provides powerful insights into query plan choices and performance, giving you more control over which execution plans the optimizer uses while helping you spot plan regressions.

And now, with SQL Databases in Fabric, Query Store continues to shine as it leverages this powerful feature to enhance performance insights and ensure consistent execution plans across your workloads.

In this session, we’ll explore how Query Store works, how to configure it for your environment (including Fabric), and most importantly, how it can save you time and effort by quickly highlighting performance differences caused by query plan changes, identifying anomalies, and solving issues in minutes. Through a combination of discussion and live demos, you'll learn how Query Store answers the question, “Why was my query slow?” and why it should be your go-to tool for performance tuning in Azure SQL DB, Managed Instance, and now SQL Databases in Fabric.

title: Unlocking Productivity and Insights with Microsoft Fabric Task Flows and Copilot
abstract:
In the modern data landscape, organizations demand streamlined workflows and integrated tools to harness the power of their data. Microsoft Fabric Task Flows provides a unified framework for designing and orchestrating complex data processes across Fabric's ecosystem, from ingestion and transformation to analysis and visualization.

This session will showcase the real-world benefits of Task Flows, illustrating how they simplify data management, enhance collaboration, and ensure scalability for organizations of all sizes. This session is based on clients who have tried Task Flows in preview and we will give you insights to maximize your experience.

Using Copilot in Microsoft Fabric leverages AI to redefine how workflows are created and optimized. Using industry examples, we will show how users can generate pipelines, automate repetitive tasks, and receive intelligent recommendations for performance improvements, enabling even non-technical users to easily drive sophisticated data operations.

This session will highlight the tangible value of Fabric Task Flows and Copilot through practical demonstrations and case studies.

You will discover how this integrated, AI-powered approach can unlock new possibilities and transform your organization's data strategy.

title: Unlocking Synergy: Exploring Snowflake and Fabric Integration with Iceberg Tables & Mirroring
abstract:
In the ever-evolving landscape of data architecture, understanding the synergistic relationship between Snowflake and Microsoft Fabric has become crucial. While the Better Together story of Databricks and Microsoft Fabric using Delta as their storage format is well-known, a new narrative emerges with Fabric's support for Iceberg Tables, opening up new possibilities for Snowflake integration. Join us in this in-depth session as we uncover the potential and explore the details of these integrations.

Our detailed Deep Dive will guide you through various integration techniques, from Snowflake mirroring to metadata virtualization with Iceberg Tables. We will navigate step-by-step through the processes in both Snowflake and Fabric, ensuring you understand how this collaboration functions. Furthermore, we will address essential questions about the strategic advantages, limitations, and practical applications of these integrations.

This session is a must-attend for data architects, engineers, Snowflake enthusiasts, and anyone eager to understand how these powerful platforms can work harmoniously together. We promise to deliver insightful answers and a clear roadmap to effectively harness the capabilities of Snowflake and Microsoft Fabric in tandem. Don't miss out on this opportunity to expand your knowledge and enhance your data strategies.

title: Unlocking the Potential of Azure AI Agent Service with Microsoft Fabric AI Skills
abstract:
This session will explore the capabilities of Azure AI Agent Service, focusing on its seamless integration with Microsoft Fabric AI Skills. Attendees will learn how to unlock powerful data analysis capabilities by grounding AI agents with enterprise data. The integration enables businesses to transform their data into conversational Q&A systems, simplifying access to insights via chat.
By combining Azure AI Agents with Microsoft Fabric, businesses can drive value through intelligent orchestration and simplified data interactions.

title: Unlocking the Power of Azure SQL Hyperscale - AI, Performance and Beyond
abstract:
Join us at Fabcon to explore the Azure SQL Database Hyperscale. We'll discuss its architecture and use cases, highlighting benefits like larger database sizes, faster throughput, and continuous priming. Learn how these advancements boost scalability, speed, and reliability in data management. Stay ahead with the cutting-edge features of Azure SQL Database Hyperscale.
We'll dive into real-world use cases and innovations that demonstrate the power of Azure SQL in driving the next generation of databases. Discover how organizations are leveraging Hyperscale for mission-critical applications, and how vector support enhances performance for complex queries and AI workloads. Experience firsthand the transformative impact of Azure SQL Database in various industries and understand why it is the preferred choice for modern data solutions.

title: Unmasking Unconscious Bias: Building Inclusive and Fair Teams
abstract: In today's diverse workplace, unconscious bias can subtly influence decisions and interactions, impacting team dynamics and overall inclusivity. Join us for an engaging session on "Unmasking Unconscious Bias: Building Inclusive and Fair Teams," where we'll delve into the roots of unconscious bias and its effects on team cohesion and performance. Through real-world examples and actionable strategies, we'll explore how to identify and mitigate these biases, fostering a more equitable and supportive environment for all team members. Whether you're a leader, manager, or team member, this session will equip you with the tools to create a culture of inclusivity and fairness, driving both personal and organizational growth.

title: Unveiling the Inner Workings of the Fabric Warehouse
abstract:
Join us for an enlightening session where we take a deep dive into the internal architecture of the Fabric Warehouse. This session will guide you through the lifecycle of a query, providing an in-depth look at how our storage engine leverages cutting-edge open formats and patterns. These innovations offer customers a myriad of features, making the Fabric Warehouse the best-in-market SaaS Warehouse that natively embraces an open data format.

We'll also explore the design of our distributed query processing engine, which is engineered to deliver petabyte-scale performance through elasticity and resiliency. This "how stuff works" journey into the architecture of the Fabric Warehouse promises to be both informative and inspiring. Don't miss this opportunity to gain a comprehensive understanding of the technological marvels that power the Fabric Warehouse.

title: Upgrade Pathways into Fabric Data Factory
abstract:
Data Factory in Microsoft Fabric brings Power Query and Azure Data Factory together into a modern trusted data integration experience that empowers data and business professionals to extract, load, and transform data for their organization. In addition, powerful data orchestration capabilities enable you to build simple to complex data workflows that orchestrate the steps needed for your data integration needs.

Join this session to learn about existing and upcoming product capabilities, as well as best practices, that will make it seamless for you to upgrade your existing solutions and start leveraging Data Factory in Microsoft Fabric.

title: Using AI to Drive Efficiency: A Tour of SQL Copilots
abstract: Unlock the future of data productivity with a hands-on exploration of AI-powered Copilots! In this session, we’ll dive into Copilot in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), Microsoft Copilot in Azure with NL2SQL and SQL, and Copilot for SQL Databases in Microsoft Fabric. Discover how each Copilot meets you where you are, and how each introduces efficiency into your SQL workflow. With real-world demos to showcase their power in action, and many best practice tips along the way, you’ll leave inspired and ready to transform how you interact with SQL, anywhere.

title: Using SQL Database Projects in SQL Server Data Tools
abstract:
Do you know how many orphaned objects are in your databases? Or references to columns, views, tables, or stored procedures that are long since removed or renamed and forgotten? Are you reluctant to change the name of a table or column because you don't know all the places it could be referenced?

Tracking the design changes of a SQL database over time and across multiple environments (dev, test, and prod) can be difficult. And if you have multiple team members who can make changes, then coordinating those changes is also challenging.

A database project in SQL Server Data Tools (SSDT, or Visual Studio) defines the schema of a database using the practice of "Desired State Configuration". This means that all the scripts in the database project are CREATE statements, and the scripts as a whole define the desired state of the database. Using this project source code, we can deploy to any target database and the deployment process will apply all the schema changes necessary to bring that target to the desired schema.

In this session I will show the important features of database projects and the development practices necessary to ensure that your deployments are as fast as possible and retain the existing data that may be present in the target database. I'll show the value of the strong schema checking, refactoring support for object renaming, and how to implement default security, automated data patches, and support for referencing external objects, such as cross-database table references. Finally I'll show how you can use a git repository in Azure DevOps and have code reviews and project compilation checks as part of a check-in operation.

If you use database projects in SSDT, you can be much more confident in the quality of your SQL code and in the reliability of your database deployments.

title: Viz It Live: An Audience-Driven Adventure
abstract: Welcome to Viz It Live! In this show, you call the shots! We’ll create data visualizations in Power BI based upon audience feedback. You pick the dataset, set the theme, and decide the type of visual, then watch as we tackle the challenge of creating meaningful insights under the clock and some pressure. Come for the Power BI tips, stay for the amusing banter.

title: Warehouse in Microsoft Fabric: Architecture Deep Dive
abstract:
Warehouse architecture includes VertiPaq, SQL Server Query Optimizer, and the new version of Polaris. How has Polaris evolved since Azure Synapse Analytics' Serverless SQL Pool? How has transaction support been added? What is V-ORDER's relevance to the Parquet file format, and how does it improve performance with VertiPaq? These functionalities will be demonstrated during the session, and you will gain a better understanding of how the Warehouse works under the hood.

This talk is intended for architects and developers. Join this session to ensure you're using the technology optimally or to avoid the common pitfalls if you're just getting started.

title: Welcome to the Party: Microsoft Fabric for DBAs
abstract:
For too long, DBAs have felt like they've been left out of the party, watching from the sidelines as others enjoyed the innovations and excitement of Microsoft Fabric. But the tables have turned! With the introduction of Fabric Databases, DBAs are now invited to the glitz and glamour of the main event.

Join me in this session to discover how Microsoft Fabric unifies your transactional and analytical workloads on a single, powerful data platform. We'll explore the seamless integration of the SQL Server database engine we all know and love with the flexibility of replicated delta tables in OneLake. You'll learn how to utilize your existing DBA skills to monitor and maintain Fabric Databases and see how they compare to other features, like Fabric Mirroring in SQL PaaS, so you don't have to gamble with your choices.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to hit the jackpot with Microsoft Fabric, where every DBA is a high roller!

title: What's New in Fabric Capacities
abstract:
Capacities are the foundation for all Microsoft Fabric workloads. This session will provide an overview of what's new in Fabric Capacities. For instance, we will talk about:
- Surge Protection to help you get ahead of capacity outages
- Improvements to monitoring and observability in Capacity metrics, e.g., tools to help you monitor your capacity in real time through the Real Time Hub (RTH)
- Customer pain points and tips to help you better manage your capacities at scale

title: Why Write-Back in Fabric Is Going to Change Planning Forever
abstract:
The introduction of Power BI’s Write-Back to Fabric Databases feature is making waves across industries, forever changing the way organizations approach planning and decision-making.

In this session, Collectiv’s experts unpack the transformative potential of this capability, explaining how it streamlines workflows, enhances collaboration, and enables real-time updates directly within Power BI.

Discover practical applications for your business, understand key considerations for adoption, and learn how to prepare your organization to leverage this groundbreaking technology for modernized planning.

title: You Could Have Invented Fabric: a Beginner's Guide
abstract:
Fabric can be an overhwelming technology if you are brand new. First, it's not one technology, but many technologies that have been put under one umbrella. Second, it builds on a lot of big data patterns and practices that may be new to you.

In this presentation we'll see how with enough time and money, you could have invented Fabric yourself, specifically the delta lake part. We'll explain the tooling by focusing on the pain points that it solves.

If you are wondering why you would ever switch to Fabric, this session is for you.

title: Zero Trust in Action: Key Azure Security Principles
abstract:
Are you planning to move your databases to the cloud but concerned about ensuring your data is 100% secure? Whether your data resides on-premises or in the cloud, implementing robust security measures is critical to safeguarding the data tier of your applications. This session will show how the multi-layered, defense-in-depth security techniques work and strategies to protect your Azure SQL database.

This Demo centric session will cover the below topics:
1. Network Security: Best practices for securing your network and controlling access.
2. Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC): Managing permissions and roles effectively.
3. Row-Level Security: Implementing fine-grained access controls within your database.
4. Auditing: Monitoring database activities to meet compliance requirements.
5. Advanced Threat Protection: Detecting and mitigating potential threats proactively.
6. Encryption Layers: Exploring options such as Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) and Always Encrypted.

By the end of this session, you will gain actionable insights and practical knowledge to make informed security decisions and confidently implement these techniques to secure your data in Azure SQL Database.

title: Secure and Govern Your Data Estate with Microsoft Fabric and Purview
abstract: This session will focus on the better together story with Microsoft Fabric and Purview. Takeaways such as the purposes of the Onelake Catalog and Unified Catalog and newer innovations with the two products will be covered.
